Review_text: The Michelin is no indication of the food

There is air conditioning, the shrimps are not fresh, the skin is stuck to the meat and can't be peeled off, the shrimp heads are also black, the service attitude is average, different customers are arranged at the same table, there are not enough service staff and they can't speak English, and you have to pay an additional 5% service charge

🥺🥺🥺 no credit card, only cash, not convenient

I rarely write bad reviews, but my experience at Bep Hen was so frustrating that I have to warn others.

First, they DO NOT accept credit cards. This is extremely inconvenient for tourists in this day and age. To make matters worse, the nearest ATM was out of order. We almost couldn't pay our bill because we couldn't get cash. How is this acceptable for a popular restaurant?

Secondly, the seating management was terrible. We were told to sit outside and that they would call us when an indoor, air-conditioned table was available. Later, we saw with our own eyes that at least THREE indoor tables were cleaned and left empty, yet no one came to get us. If we hadn't gone inside to check, we would have been forgotten forever. This felt incredibly unfair and disorganized.

The food was okay, but the horrible payment situation and the unprofessional service completely ruined our meal. There are countless amazing Food options in Da Nang. Choose one that accepts cards and treats customers fairly.

This restaurant was a terrible experience! First, it's 2025, and they still don't accept credit cards? Even worse, the nearby ATM wasn't working. I almost couldn't pay because I couldn't withdraw money. It was so embarrassing!

Also, the seating arrangement was infuriating—they initially said there were no seats indoors and told us to wait for an air-conditioned table. Then, three tables opened up and we weren't called! If I hadn't seen it myself, I might have forgotten about it. This kind of discrepancy in treatment was truly disappointing.
Overall, the food was acceptable, but the poor payment methods and chaotic management completely detracted from the experience. I wouldn't recommend this place for tourists who need convenient payment or fair service; there are so many better options in Da Nang.
Good food, good service but a bit pricey.

We visited for lunch on the last day of our trip. I felt like I'd tried all the Vietnamese cuisine, so I decided to go here for some home-cooked food.

The restaurant had a lovely, cute atmosphere.

I ordered something like deep-fried eggplant in a marinade, sweet and spicy stir-fried pork, soup, and rice.

The soup was on the lighter side.

The pork had a sweet and spicy soy sauce flavor that went perfectly with the rice! It lacked the spice of Taiwanese braised pork rice.

The eggplant was piping hot, likely because it'd been deep-fried. It was in a sweet but slightly spicy broth, so it felt like deep-fried eggplant in a marinade.

We arrived at 11:30, and soon after, a steady stream of customers, from tourists to locals, arrived for lunch, and the restaurant quickly filled up.

The staff were very friendly.

[Note] While the Google Maps overview says they accept credit cards, they only accept cash. Unfortunately, I didn't have any cash on me, so I asked the staff at the entrance for directions to the nearest ATM, but the one on the side that you turn left down the street from the restaurant was gone.
It’s first time I knew Morning glory is actually kangkung! Great experience tasting local cuisine in Vietnam…

The place has a really nice atmosphere and the decor is lovely. The food was decent, nothing that really stood out, but we still enjoyed it overall. The caramelised braised pork and the omelette were definitely the highlights for us.
Very helpful team
Got the caramelized pork belly, frog legs, morning glory. You need to eat the dishes with rice so order that. Great spot for lunch!
space ok
All the dishes were delicious. I highly recommend this place!
Two dishes good. Two dishes bad. Probably won’t come back. Meh…
Great food and great service
Very delicious food, spacious and cool space
It's been a long time since I've had such delicious food, authentic Vietnamese food 👍👍👍 …

Michelin-starred restaurant

⭐️What I had:
・Stir-fried eggplant
・Tofu stewed in tomato sauce
・Pork stew
・Water spinach
・Fried spring rolls
Rice was also included.

We ordered about five dishes, and everything was reasonably priced! And delicious. Everything was delicious!!
With drinks,
It came to just under ¥3,000 for two people.
I highly recommend this restaurant.
Average taste, great atmosphere
Small, hidden restaurant, classic style, clean, good service, delicious food

We had nothing but positive experiences at Bep Hen, a Vietnamese restaurant! My whole family visited this establishment for dinner and were so happy we were able to spontaneously get a table.
The menu is simply amazingly varied, especially the extensive fish selection—it's rare to find that! We were also pleasantly surprised by the selection of vegetarian dishes; there's something for everyone. The meat dishes were excellent, and my husband and I really enjoyed them.
The restaurant's atmosphere is unique, with a combination of vintage and eclecticism creating a special charm. The prices are quite reasonable, which is also a pleasant surprise. We can confidently recommend Bep Hen to anyone looking to try authentic Vietnamese cuisine and enjoy a pleasant atmosphere!

The quality of the food has dropped dramatically since the restaurant was selected by Michelin. Did they change the cooking staff? Before, everything was incredibly delicious, so it's a shame. I wish they'd go back to the previous quality. I'm so sad.

absolutely delightful food and atmosphere!! cannot praise this place highly enough!
food and drinks were delicious and very well priced, the jasmine flower dish and the lemongrass and chilli tofu were wonderful!
tip- this place only takes cash
Best tofu I’ve ever had! (Lemongrass chill) will definitely be back

I ate at Bếp Hen, a Michelin-starred restaurant in Da Nang.
The restaurant is small but lively, and its charm lies in its ability to capture the local atmosphere.
It was frequented by both tourists and locals, demonstrating its popularity.

I think the flavors here go very well with Japanese palate. ◎
It was a casual yet highly satisfying dining experience that made it easy to see why it was selected for a Michelin star.
I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to enjoy local food in Da Nang.

Wonderful staff, delicious local food. Reasonable prices for a Michelin guide 😊
I recommend it to anyone who likes authentic interiors and trying new and unusual things. The menu is very varied, I was pleased with the choice of fish dishes.
The children were also delighted and ordered two portions each 🙈

This was honestly the best restaurant we tried in Da Nang! Every dish was flavorful and freshly prepared, and the quality really stood out compared to other places we visited. The service was warm and attentive, and the overall atmosphere made the dining experience even better. If you’re in Da Nang and want a truly memorable meal, this is the place to go!

It was right next to my hotel. I thought the restaurant was lovely, and then I saw the Michelin sign on the entrance. I went in for lunch. I had a lunch that's popular with Vietnamese people. It was delicious. I realized later that I should have ordered some vegetables. Also, they didn't have any hot tea, so I gave it four stars.
Traditional central vietnamese home style food is delicious, very quaint atmosphere, waiters don't speak english well but are helpful and quick
Great place, good food. A little stuffy with a big crowd but not really a problem if you are willing to squeeze. The caramelised pork is the best dish.

Today my family and I were in this establishment. The woman administrator is very unpleasant. When you ask the waiters something, there is fear in their eyes of doing something wrong. It is very annoying. We asked for juice without ice, the boy brought it with ice, and then the woman administrator very loudly attacks the guy. The whole situation is very annoying. The guy went back to the kitchen, apparently, just removed the ice and brought it to us. A very unpleasant aftertaste from this establishment.
Experience the variety of Vietnamese dishes, this is truly a wonderful experience.
I was introduced by friends from Saigon so I came here and experienced the food here, it's really delicious, the dishes are full of Vietnamese flavor.
The restaurant reminds me of my childhood days when my mother cooked for me, a wonderful restaurant.

I came to the restaurant for breakfast, didn't have to wait for a table and felt the friendly and good service attitude made me feel comfortable and happy with the food being very tasty and delicious. I felt the experience at BEP HEN was worth it.
fun, harmonious, with funny and friendly staff. Especially the food is super delicious 10 points
Delicious food, enthusiastic and friendly staff
The restaurant suits my vibe, the food is diverse and delicious, you don't have to wait too long, everyone should come and eat once.
The food was delicious, but unfortunately they only accept cash and don't take credit cards. The nearest ATM was also out of service, which was a pain.

This is a "restaurant with a great atmosphere." The flavors were very bland and light, as if tailored to foreigners. This may vary depending on personal taste. What was disappointing was the staff's response. One item was missing, so I ended up leaving without eating, and the process wasn't smooth. I don't think I'll be back.

Ate once at the restaurant and didn't think I would come back
The food is generally not expensive compared to the location but the quality is "impressive" with my experience: FOOD POISONING
My group ordered basic dishes: minced meat fried with eggs, mussel soup with water spinach, stuffed beans with meat in tomato sauce, fried pork, braised fish....
The restaurant seasoned well. The meal was quite good although there were mosquitoes (I sat on the 2nd floor) and the air conditioning was not cool enough for the meal.
We ate and sweated, were bitten by mosquitoes and out of the group of 6 people, 3 got food poisoning
1 person had mild diarrhea all night
My little friend and I vomited and had diarrhea right after dinner at the restaurant and it lasted for nearly 2 days
The waitress was cute but the manager seemed unfriendly. The customer didn't care about the greeting, even though you sat right at the entrance
In short, it was FEAR.
60k for roasted chicken rice
The best restaurant of our vacation in Vietnam

Everything was delicious except for the beef soup (purple)!
The eggplant dish was just the right amount of salty, and the fried tofu and tomato sauce were salty and garlicky, perfect for Korean palates.
The spring rolls were fried, but they were delicious because they had lots of shrimp!
However, the air conditioning wasn't very cool.

I visited Bep Hen, a restaurant featured in the Michelin Guide.
The atmosphere was very pleasant.
It was very sentimental and antique. Even the menu...
I ordered about five items, and they were all so-so.
It's not a restaurant worth going out of your way to try. I think Grandma's Kitchen is even tastier.
This was the first time I left a plate of food unfinished since coming to Vietnam. (That doesn't mean it wasn't delicious, though.)
There's a 5% VAT charge here, whether you pay by cash or card. Please keep that in mind when ordering.

The restaurant was packed with Japanese customers, and the food was home-cooked to suit Japanese tastes. 
The stewed tofu and tomatoes, stir-fried eggplant and minced meat, and water spinach were all tender, and the fried rice was also excellent. My father, who is in his 70s, also seemed to enjoy it. All of this was surprisingly priced at just 3,000 yen.
The food was okay, but the service was terrible. It was too small, and if there was a wait, it was a bit burdensome to wait next to someone while eating.

I've been here many times but this is the last time. The food is getting worse and worse, the boiled meat with pickled cucumber is so white, when asked why there is no chili, onion, chives, they just like that, ok. When asked if there is eggplant, they ran out since morning, every time they run out since morning hihi. When asked if fried tofu is not served with shrimp paste and perilla, they do that, ok. I also told the waitress that I was not satisfied at all, maybe she thought the restaurant was crowded enough, it was okay for me to complain.

Everyone who visited this Michelin-starred restaurant with me was satisfied.

We arrived right at opening time, and everything was clean and well-prepared.

The owner spoke English fluently, and we were very friendly.

I initially ordered three servings of rice, but they said it was a generous portion, so I changed it to one. The rice came in a large bowl, so you could scoop it into individual plates.

I usually enjoy Vietnamese home-style cooking, and this restaurant was satisfying in terms of taste, price, and quantity. The food was generally not salty, which made it enjoyable to eat, and my companions said it was the best spring roll they'd ever had.

The chili tofu was perfectly fried, crispy, and tender. The braised eggplant 🍆 was just the right amount of simmered, bringing out the natural flavor of the eggplant. The braised pork belly 🥓 was also well-seasoned, with the perfect balance of meat and fat.

The restaurant is filled with antiques and props, making it a great place to browse while dining, and the lack of tables makes it ideal for quiet conversation.

The owner and staff are all friendly, so we enjoyed a Michelin-starred restaurant at a reasonable price.

Very cool restaurant with cozy interior and nice service. We had to wait a bit on a bench but only a minute or so.

We’ve just picked a random restaurant next to our hotel and didn’t know it got the Michelin star. And to be honest, it wasn’t any special to me. Despite the fact they added a ton of garlic everywhere, the dishes in this restaurant I knew from other places and from eating at Vietnamese homes weren’t that aromatic. It’s good but IMHO don’t expect anything above average.
All the dishes I ordered were so unexpected 😞 is that the shop too famous that’s why the quality bad ?
The building has a nice atmosphere, and the food is cheap and delicious, with a Chinese-Vietnamese feel.
Amazing flavors and great pricing . We reallly enjoyed the meal .
Superb historical atmosphere with old maps on the wall and lots of trinkets. A place recommended by Lonely Planet and we understand why! The food is delicious, a must-see!
Very delicious, I recommend you go.
Delicious comfort food with a wide variety of interesting dishes. We loved the stuffed tomatos especially. Nice decor.
This appears to be a joke in the wall restaurant, but the food is outstanding, with a wide choice and very reasonable prices, if you enjoy your food or are a foodie it’s a must visit

Michelin noted Small restaurant, decorated tastefullt with old stuff from 60 70,  staff are friendly, nothern Vietnames food is very nicely done, not sweet not salty not oily price reasonnable approx 300.000 vnd/ person
Highly recommended

Two people ate the following: braised mackerel, braised pork, eggplant, spring rolls, and rice. The two braised dishes were just okay, but the eggplant dish was surprisingly good. The braised dishes were pre-made and reheated in a pot. For others, it would be a good idea to study the menu before ordering. It's close to Korean cuisine, but it's not a place that caters to the palate. The braised fish was about the same as the average Korean braised mackerel.

I had lunch here but was very disappointed with the service attitude of the staff of this restaurant. There were many tables on the 2nd floor but the staff did not let me sit at the table I wanted while no one had booked. I found the service was poor and the food was getting worse and worse.
It's a shame. I chose it because it was Michelin-starred. The beef was sold out. The stir-fried yeoju was missed. Please keep your original intentions in mind~^^

I went there without thinking much, but the food was so delicious. The stir-fried eggplant was also delicious, and I asked for a recommendation because I wanted to eat soup, and the snakehead soup that was recommended was also delicious. :)
Regret that I should have chosen the menu better? It was my fault for thinking that sweet and sour chicken would obviously be Chinese seasoned chicken.

Came here with high expectations and an empty stomach. Left disappointed and unfulfilled feeling.

Ordered 3 out of the 6 signature dishes:
- Braised pork , eggplant, snake head fish.
Generally lacks any flavour and taste. Not sure how the food got its michelin for the last 2 years. Feeling very doubtful.

While decor was very homely, the environment was not very clean. After 7 days in Hoi an/ da nang, it’s the first time we got bitten by mosquito.
Good atmosphere, nice music but the food is not for everyone, bony
I ordered the wrong menu ㅋㅋ but the lemongrass pork was so delicious that it was good~~~ The soup tasted like Korean seaweed soup!
Delicious local
The food is delicious, the space is beautiful like the old times😋
Vietnamese restaurant. Authentic dishes, quite delicious and diverse.
Authentic atmosphere with amazing cuisine. Randomly dropped in while driving by and saw the Michelin sign. I'm happy.
It was delicious

Great Vietnamese dishes. Very tasty. Fusion  style, with garlic and lemongrass ingredients. We ordered tofu, eggplant and fish dishes.  They were very tasty. The place is clean and has nice atmosphere. Give it a try.

The restaurant recommended by the driver is very similar to Vietnamese-style Chinese food.
We ordered spare ribs, pineapple shrimp (the shrimps were big, there were 7 in total), fried spring rolls, chicken with fish sauce, a fish dish (tasted like sea bass), lemongrass tofu (the tofu was too hard)

The meal was OK, but the charging method was strange
You can't pay by credit card, only cash, but they added 5%
When traveling in Da Nang, cash-accepting stores will not charge extra service fees
If you pay by credit card, they will add 3%. It is recommended that you ask the store's charging method before each consumption.

I went into this restaurant thinking I'd just eat a little bit, but
I ate soy sauce and my appetite exploded~~!!
It was such a delicious and enjoyable time~^^

flavor was okay. too much pepper. the fried rice was salty. the worst part is we ordered fried chicken and we received 50%bones 25% garlic and chili and 25%meat. the meat was mostly skin and cartilage. here is the picture of trying to eat all the meat. not Michelin star worthy.
Roll?? It was super tasty

It was a nice restaurant with local flavors.
Even if you come as a group of two guys, you can enjoy eating and drinking here. …
Place to experience tourism in Da Nang. Should book a table in advance because it is very crowded.
Every time I go to Da Nang and crave rice, I always eat at Hen kitchen. You should book a table early because it is often full.
Hidden gem in Da Nang
Loved the food here. Subtle flavours and loads of fresh vegetarian dishes, despite not being a vege restaurant. Highly recommend!

I only found out it was recommended by Michelin when I came here. There are so many colors so it’s not easy to choose the first time, but I followed the waiter’s suggestion and it was fine. Also, there is no drink in Vietnam that is not sweet, but the juice here is natural, which is really good.

Nice food and wonderful atmosphere! There so many interesting details in interior, including old maps. If you like history, you definitely should visit it. I also admired food. It was the first time when I tried soup with Tonkin jasmine, I …

Unique, quirky restaurant adored with antiques, Bep Hen doesn’t disappoint. The service was quick & friendly, every dish was oozing with flavour however the lemongrass & chilli pork belly was everyone’s favourite. Very happy we were able to get in.

BẾP HÊN is Da Nang’s answer to what comfort food should be—Michelin Select–awarded and set in a charming home-turned-restaurant on bustling Lê Hồng Phong. Step inside and you’re greeted by potted plants, vintage tile, and the warmth of a …
our server, bao tran provided the best hospitality and the food was amazing and too quality. as well as the authentic and unique environment, nothing to complain whatsoever
DaNang welcomed us with this amazing restaurant. We had a very good choice for our first meal in DaNang. Food all great, atmosphere good. We loved it. 🤩 …

We found a hair while eating.
We didn't need it so we asked them to remove it, and when we finished eating and were about to pay, they brought us a new one. It was awful. …
Bếp Hên in Da Nang offers a delightful culinary experience, blending authentic Vietnamese flavors with a nostalgic ambiance. …

Unique and original decor and atmosphere. Friendly staff. Very wide selection of dishes. We tried the snake fish and the prawns. It was delicious. Relatively small, so remember to book if you come on the weekend.
The food was quite tasty for me. I'm from the south, it was my first time visiting Da Nang, and the first restaurant I ate at when I got off the plane was this one.
In a country full of great food, this is one of the best meals I’ve ever had. Great staff and clean, rustic interior makes it even nicer.
Cool vibes but food was just ok. Caramelized pork was a bit sweet, fried frog with lemongrass was good, fried morning glory didn't have much flavor.

Cozy, nostalgic space. Typical home-cooked food. The minus point is that the braised fish and braised meat dishes are quite salty. Need to be less salty to suit many people and tourists coming to Da Nang.
The food is delicious, the price is reasonable. The space is cozy. A place to visit when coming to Da Nang.
Best Vietnamese Traditional Restaurant
It feels like eating home-cooked food, every dish is suitable for rice, and tastes worthy of Michelin stars! And the staff are very kind Good👍
delicious, authentic, and so many good choices that we had to come back again! lovely decor as well. thank you for a wonderful experience!

2025/06/22
I came here without knowing it was a Michelin restaurant.
The interior was cute and the food was delicious. The eggplant stuffed with meat and the fried rice were delicious.
Delicious food, clean, cute and quick staff. Always a destination every time I come to Da Nang

A note to Koreans:

The restaurant owner doesn't treat customers well (in the original), and the English-speaking male employee is rude. The food tastes just as good, or even better, elsewhere.

While I was eating, they were talking too loudly, perhaps to train the staff. I felt uncomfortable and uncomfortable the entire time.

It's not worth coming here to eat, but I recommend not spending your own money to experience this kind of atmosphere.

Don't let this ruin your trip.
There are plenty of restaurants out there, so it's better to go somewhere else.

This is the first time I've experienced this kind of treatment while traveling, and I'm not happy about it.

Such bad service as the waitress with such bad attitudes to scold at customer! As we had make reservation and he get confused on our reservation, but he is the one mad at us ! What’s wrong to this young guy at the front counter? As customer, do we need to get with all these nonsenses from him? I will never back to this restaurant anymore as long as the young guy at the front counter still worked in that restaurant ! If you are the owner of this restaurant, please take some actions on this!!! Appreciate it.
Home-cooked Vietnamese food, like going home and eating grandma's cooking. It's so good. It feels so good.😍
Very good food, especially the pineapple fish .
Best taste I have ever had in Da nang during my 5night stay. We ordered 6 dishes and all are tasty and delicious. Will come again next time .
Great food at a reasonable price!

The restaurant has poor service, the manager has a bad attitude, acts threateningly, steals while screaming, and does not pay debts. I suggest you review your management style and review the work of your employees and subordinates. Stores should avoid this restaurant to avoid wasting time cooperating.
Very good authentic food 👌🏼 …

Good food with authentic home cook favor. Feel like eating with home comfy.
Fried morning glory with garlic
Fried pork belly with lemon glass & chilli
Bitter gourd soups

The bitter gourd soups on par or even better than famous Kulai bitter gourd soups in Johor

A restaurant worth checking out

Meals were delicious and delivered with a smile 😃
Quirky decore from the past.

I went there after seeing a review saying that Banh Xeo was delicious, but
they said that Banh Xeo or rice noodles were not on the menu.
They said that they sell Vietnamese home-cooked meals that you can eat with rice.
I chose and ate egg fried (with tomato), eggplant, morning glory, and pork.
I asked the waiter which pork dish was the best, and I chose the one he recommended.
It was really delicious. It was the most delicious and satisfying meal I had in Da Nang.
The staff was also friendly and quick to respond. I highly recommend it to Koreans who miss rice.

Honestly horrible. There are lizards falling from the roof. Fell on my mother while she was eating her food and honestly it ruined our appetite. No help from the staff when dealing with the lizard. Makes me question the cleanliness of their kitchen. Don’t get the Michelin star rating honestly worst food I have had in Vietnam

【🍽️ Bếp Hên 】
Danang Food Record 𓂃𓈒𓏸◌ꕤ

✧ Usage Data
・Visit Date: May 10, 2025
・Location: 8 minutes walk from Dragon Bridge
・Number of people: 2 adults

✧ Menu ordered
・4 dishes + 2 drinks
・Total: Approximately 404.040 VND (approximately 2,240 yen)

✧ Good points
・A restaurant selected by Michelin 2024
・From the exterior to the interior of the restaurant, everything is cute and looks like an old Vietnamese house
・The toilet is on the second floor, and the interior of the second floor is also wonderful

✧ Things I was a little concerned about
・It was crowded, so it might be better to make a reservation.

✧ A note
It's a restaurant where you can taste Vietnamese home cooking, and it's delicious. The white rice was also not too strong and I was able to eat it. It's so cute that I wanted to take pictures of the entire restaurant.
Vietnamese home cooking is so delicious. It's food made with herbs, so it's healthy and doesn't make you feel uncomfortable. I want to go there again and eat it.

For our final dinner in Vietnam, we made a reservation at a Michelin Guide restaurant.
Traditional Vietnamese food. 有妈妈的味道 kind. We loved every dish!

It was a small and cosy place. Lucky we made reservation this time round! ✌🏻
They have a bottled version of Beer La Lou, which is delicious. I think the price is high because they got the Michelin Bib Gourmand award.
Wow! I wanna try everything. I think I can stay in Danang untill I do and come here everyday!
so delicious, just like mom's cooking
One of best restaurant in Danang
The food tastes similar to Taiwanese home-cooked food.

I was worried because people said it didn't taste good, but it tastes like kebakke. We enjoyed it very well. The soybean paste was moist and the stir-fried eggplant was served right away. I especially like spices, so I highly recommend the lemongrass stir-fried tofu. The locals drink a lot here, so instead of just going to the seafood restaurant, next time I should order several things and have a drink here. I was satisfied.

We (two people) had the stir fried pork belly, braised Eggplant and tofu in tamarind sauce.

Very, very tasty and am feeling stuffed
Good size portions.
Disgusting restaurant, iced tea for 10k...Da Nang streets also have free iced tea. Boycott

🇻🇳 Vietnamese restaurant in classic style with a bit of family cuisine. We enjoyed all the dishes we tried, from roasted lemongrass and chili pork belly and meat-stuffed tofu, to red spinach soup and stir-fried morning glory. A place worth trying, but if the restaurant is too crowded or full, you still have other options nearby.
———-
🇦🇺 Old school Vietnamese aesthetic restaurant with family cooking. We enjoyed all of the dishes we tried from the pork belly and tofu with mince to the red spinach soup and fried water spinach. A good place if you can walk in to an empty table, probably not worth lining up for though with what else is on offer in the vicinity.

DELICIOUS!
Me came around 1.30pm on a Sunday, no line at all , just walked in a got a seat

Ordered :
1. Braised pork belly with bamboo shoots 5/5🌟
2. Potato leaf soup with shrimp 3/5🌟
3. Boiled? pork belly (I don't like it but my bf say's it's nice)

We were on our 5th day here , was abit sick of Vietnam food dy , but the food were really GREAT 😍 a different style of Vietnam food

A home-style restaurant that I found after reading several reviews.
Location, taste, service are great
The food is delicious
The place is a bit too warm for the day I visited (it was quite humid). Food was good, reasonable price, very friendly staffs. Will come back.

We came here because it was recommended by Michelin book. Food was tasty but very tough and difficult to eat. It is a shame because the sauce was very tasty. Ambiance is 5 stars. Vintage. Cool jazz music. Total would be 5 stars if meat would be tender.

Reviewer_name: Anchanชุดแต่งงานสไตล์มินิมอล
Review_text: The food is not spicy. Recommend ordering food Various flavors

Ordered the stuffed eggplant with minced pork, the tofu in tomato sauce, rice, and a lemon tea. All delicious. Far too much food for 1 person but no regrets to be able to try more at very reasonable prices (all for 210k). Nice atmosphere and good service too!
Food is okay
Very cozy restaurant and delicious food. The spring rolls are really good. I highly recommend for small and larger groups.

This is a delicious banh xeo restaurant.
Take it 2 or 3 times
I went twice, the first day and the last day, and it was delicious.
The food is delicious, but the service is poor.
The restaurant is comfortably decorated, the staff is friendly, the food comes out quickly, suitable for family dining, will come back

It's Vietnamese home cooking
It tasted and felt similar to a Korean restaurant.
I have been in Da Nang for 4 months and this is by far the best meal I had yet. Flavourful, fresh and authentic. So delicious. The decor is a vibe.Cannot wait to come back!

This place is a hidden gem. Food tastes like mom's cooking,  it will take you back in time, you are surrounded by antiques. The price is so reasonable,  dinner for 2 with a beer costs us under $20. The service from the young staff were excellent.

Food was good, we tried:
Pork belly with lemongrass without chilli (4.5 of 5 stars)
Seaweed with mushroom (3 stars)
Eggplant (3 stars)
Fried tofu with minced pork (4 stars)
Fried spring roll (3.5 stars)

They print the bill in vietnamese, make sure to double check with the menu to avoid improper food charge.
My fav one, best ever

Feels like dining in someone's house, with old furniture and knick-knacks all around. Home style cooking, uncommon dishes. Enjoyed the deep fried frog with lemon grass, and claypot snakehead with tea leaves. The sweet potato leaves would be nicer if they used the younger shoots. Refreshing drinks available like mulberry, and lemongrass.

Exceptional food. Probably the best meal I’ve had in Vietnam. I had the braised pork belly with bamboo shoots and the flavours were perfectly balanced. I also had the fried aubergine with spring onions which was a simple dish done very well. The food is exceptional value as well. The only really disappointing thing is I only discovered the restaurant a day before leaving Da Nang so I wasn’t able to try the rest of the extensive menu.
I really like the atmosphere here, it feels like home, I like the food here, I highly recommend it

We visited on a Friday at 5pm without a reservation, just the two of us.
There was one other group of customers before us, but a local family arrived later, and the seats filled up.
The staff were friendly and welcoming, and ordering was easy, thanks to the menu with photos at the back. The steamed rice was more than enough for two people to share. We don't drink alcohol, but the slightly strong flavor was a perfect match. It went down really well with rice! Every dish was delicious, and we'd love to return. The restaurant's ambiance and exterior are also lovely. Our bill came to around 2,600 yen.

Enjoyed eating here - the menu items are packed with flavour and the decor of the restaurant is quaint and charming. Must try: morning glory with garlic (deliciously fragrant), minced pork and tomato (the sauce is amazing), braised egg plant and soy with minced pork, and fried tofu with lemon grass and chili. A few misses for our personal taste - such as the pineapple and chicken - flavour was nice, but the chicken was bone-in and had little meat. 4 dishes and rice were enough for two. All in all a nice experience and we will be back!

Overall the experience was awful.

Love this place! Delicious Vietnamese classics served over two floors of an old Danang house. Had the braised snakehead fish in a clay pot, the fried aubergine, and the stuffed tofu (all excellent). Highly recommended.

Excellent!
We discovered this gem by chance and ate there twice.
My favorite was the frog with lime and garlic – absolutely delicious. …
One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Vietnam! Highly recommended! Everything was excellent and the price/performance ratio was very fair.

A Bib Gourmand-certified restaurant.

The restaurant is not large, but it has a great atmosphere, with a retro and elegant feel. As it was selected as a Michelin star in 2024, all of the dishes are delicious (they are on the strong side, so they go very well with rice). The …
We sat outside on the balcony and had a delicious meal! We were served by super friendly staff, and the food was quick and delicious! Highly recommended!! Plus, it's not super expensive!
Delicious!
Excellent restaurant, delicious affordable food, will continue to support, there is a waiter named Dung who is super cute and looks forward to getting to know you
One of the best food that we had in Danang. It was delicious and felt home cooked. Simple but tasty. Recommended. …

The restaurant is in the style of the 90s, the food is delicious and seasoned to my taste, I went to eat at 7pm and the restaurant was very crowded after me, many people came and had to wait because there were no tables. Nice restaurant with traditional dishes in DaNang. I did not know that they got a Michelin award in 2024. The restaurant is very nice decorated, with lot of charm. It has 3 floors but it fills up fast so I do recommend to make a booking (they do accept bookings).

Service was choppy. They brought 4/7 dishes and then they served a big group before serving us the rest of the dishes. Maybe it was just bad timing but plan on going early to avoid delays on your food.

The food is delicious, the atmosphere is nice, but the food is slow, the service is bad, the staff is not attentive and does not take care of everyone, leaving us waiting, the food comes but the bowl of rice is not there, how are you supposed to eat it?
The food here is delicious, the space and food are home-cooked, I really like the food here.

When we come to Da Nang, we plan to try seafood, bun cha, naem nui, pho, and banh xeo, so we wander around looking for famous restaurants. However, most of the tastes have become standardized, and I think the unique Vietnamese flavors have become quite diluted. If you're looking for the authentic Vietnamese and Da Nang flavors rather than the typical dishes, I recommend this place. Just as Korea offers more than just kimchi jjigae and sippangsal (pork belly), Vietnam and Da Nang offer a wide variety of flavors. The menu here is incredibly diverse. While you can take your time choosing, I recommend asking the waiter at the counter for recommendations. I'm sure you'll find something surprising and enjoy a satisfying meal.
Nice vintage cafe, hearty and tasty portions and friendly people
A great spot on the Da Nang map! The unique atmosphere of this place won us over ♥️ Delicious food, large portions, and short, even express, serving times. Worth a visit :)
Great, very tasty meal and fast, friendly service.
Very tasty, deserves totally the Michelin guide recognition!

Not only is it a delicious home-cooked meal, but it is also a place to heal the heart and soul… Every time I visit the restaurant, it will be a new space but still warm and relaxing like the first day I set foot here!

We went to this place recommended by a tourist guide... the place was nice, the food was nothing special... it's a shame that my boyfriend and I vomited all night. Horrible experience, I don't know if it was the pork with egg or the fried pork, we were terrible.
Not recommended.
I had good lunch with my family. I will come back, sure!
The food is delicious, the decoration is old and unique. Overall, I feel very satisfied. I will come back to the restaurant.
Delicious traditional central Vietnamese home style food, nostalgic atmosphere
Very delicious central style food. Beautiful space
The staff are very friendly and quick, very helpful advice. The food is quite delicious. The space has lots of antiques and green trees.

Bếp Hên, meaning "Lucky Kitchen," is a nostalgic restaurant in Danang, brimming with retro charm. Run by an ordinary Vietnamese family, the mother personally prepares dishes that embody the flavors of home. From garlic-scented stir-fried shrimp to tender and flavorful braised pork, each dish exudes the warmth and familiarity of home.

Stepping into the restaurant feels like stepping back into the 1970s. Wooden furniture, old records, and yellowed photographs create a nostalgic and warm atmosphere. The restaurant entrance is hidden behind a lush green potted plant, making it easy to miss without careful observation.

With its authentic Vietnamese home-style cuisine and affordable prices, Bếp Hên has captivated not only locals but also international tourists. For locals, it's more than just a restaurant; it's a warm haven that holds memories. For travelers from far and wide, it's a wonderful stop to experience traditional Vietnamese home cooking, where every bite is imbued with the taste of home—that simple beauty.

If you like spicy food, you should consider it carefully (it may be a more authentic Vietnamese stir-fry, so don't expect too much)
The environment is good, the service is not too enthusiastic, and the dishes are not large
Fried lemongrass chicken: the chicken is big and fat
Fried lemongrass tofu: the tofu is very hard
Snakehead fish: a little sweet
Sweet potato leaf soup: sweet
Minced pork fried egg: average
You can use visa but there is a 4% handling fee

It felt that they got their star and sold the restaurant… the atmosphere was fantastic but the food average. It was actually prepared before we arrived (were first table for dinner). It arrived literally within 3 min, although it was fish etc… the aubergine was nothing special either, garlic chopped too tough.
The waitress was quite uninterested and was suggesting same food to all the tables (steam veggies).
I would recommend to visit this place for the cool design but not for food.

Food is ok, however would never come back again as the staff is dishonest. For the 2 times I’ve been, they messed up the bill (ie. incorrect charges) both times.

For the second time, it’s very hard to tell if it’s a misunderstanding or they tried to overcharge, so I give them the benefit of the doubt.

What I’m sure is that, for the first time, one staff very rudely told me that they don’t take card and it’s cash only, which is odd for places like this, and because the other staff was ok, I came for a second time. But the second time I paid in card with no issue. I guess they thought a tourist wouldn’t come back again and find out about the lies, but it’s dishonesty like this that will keep people from ever coming back.
The food is pretty good, but the prices are too expensive.
There's a reason it's a hidden gem haha

Great place, real local kitchen with Michelin mention
Been there twice and it was great

Highly recommend to try their stuffed tomatoes

Food is a matter of personal taste...
Personally, I didn't like the sweet and salty taste.
I ordered braised short ribs, braised tofu, stir-fried eggplant, and morning glory. The stir-fried eggplant was delicious and the braised tofu was great.
I don't know if I'll visit again.
This restaurant is incredibly fantastic, the service is fast and courteous, and even better, the dishes are exquisite. I recommend it!
Really really nice food here. Blending traditional Vietnamese food with some modern twists. The interior designs was memorable too
I feel great. I will come back next time.

I have come and experienced here a great place to eat for tourists The old restaurant with familiar dishes reminded me of the dinner my mother cooked for me when I was a child. a place worth experiencing
Everything is perfect😇
Half of the menu is missing, even from the recommendations page, this is unacceptable. They left hungry.

Disappointment! There is almost nothing from the "Mom's Favorite Dishes" section! Instead of fish, they offer pork! Michelin would never recommend this place if he was offered such a choice as we were today! I am very disappointed!

Disappointment! There is almost nothing from the "Mom's Favorite Dishes" section! Instead of fish, they offer pork! Michelin would never recommend this place if he was offered such a choice as we were today! I am very disappointed!
Cozy home made style.

Great family style meal. The umami from the belly pork fried with fermented shrimp was off the scale. Super tender and very moreish. The black pepper aubergines were the star, biting, fragrant black pepper sauce coating lovely soft aubergines and the sauce was perfect with the rice. The interior is so well designed. It's packed full of vietnamese curios and nick-nacks. 182k / £5.90 for this and a soda.

The place has a nice aesthetic with a vintage Vietnamese style, and the food is delicious. The only downside is that the staff are often on their phones with the volume turned up high. (This seems to be common in Vietnam.) Where I come from, this is considered inappropriate, as basic manners are essential in the service industry.

The food was not bad, but the service was disappointing, as the waitress showed no friendliness. The payment process was frustrating. We confirmed card payment was accepted before ordering, but the bill included a 5% service fee and an unexpected 4% card payment surcharge. When I asked about the extra fee, there was no clear explanation, and my questions went unanswered.

This was the first restaurant we visited (after Ho Chi Minh City and Hoi An) that charged an extra fee for card payments.
You can feel the atmosphere of Vietnam and the food is delicious.
Michelin star restaurant; authentic Vietnamese food and ambience at affordable prices.

A temple. It was our first dinner in Da Nang, which fell on a calm, rainy night in this beachy town. The streets were quiet, the rain heavy, the plants now nourished. Inside, Vietnamese renditions of popular Western and Eastern songs gently interrupted the stillness outside. Our server bobbed her head to the music as she brought the food—warming pork stuffed eggplant, chief among the spread—to our waterfront table. An evening of perfection, passed as we watched the leaves quaver in the deluge, the occasional bike motor by, and, ever so occasionally, the distant rumble of the a night’s thunder.

It was very delicious.
The interior of the restaurant was antique and stylish.

We tried out this restaurant due to high reviews but was a little disappointed with the dishes we ordered. Amount of food served very generous but greasy, flavour its not to our liking. Service was great and it a very cozy atmosphere.

I'll start with the food, excellent. It was all delicious, too bad the frog wasn't available (I had found the trip tonight but nothing!)
The waiter was a young guy, very friendly and attentive, he even tried to speak English. Fast food. Highly recommended
fresh ingredients, generous servings

Beautiful unique Michelin selected resturant. A charming intimate restaurant serving chef made delicious menu. It is all good!!. My taste buds do back flips here ;). Antique decor, provides a warm cozy dining experience.    - Enjoy - J
Caramelized ribs were the highlight. Everything else was good. Looking forward to a return visit

Good value for money local home cooking restaurant with a very nice interior. Came here twice during my stay in Danang and had a great time, the prices are very reasonable.
My wife picked the right restaurant for our first night visiting Vietnam. Tasty dishes that seem cooked by Mom.
Good vietnamese food, good portions, decent prices, and a nice atmosphere. Food arrived really quickly too. Recommended.
What to say for this incredible restaurant!? The food was so delicious that we went for dinner 3 times! The best authentic vietnamese food in Danang!

It is also quite affordable and many locals come to eat here too. This restaurant has three floors and we were on the second floor. The food comes out quite fast. I really love the stuffed tofu simmered in tomato sauce. Nothing groundbreaking but homey food done right.

First if all, what a wonderful setting! Good and prompt service by the staff. I was recommended the morning Glory and sweet sour chicken. The cooking is old school, harping back in home cook family meals, with punchy, well rounded flavours.

Very good food!

Good

We had a fantastic meal here and tried a variety of dishes. The fried egg with pork was perfectly seasoned, the seaweed with minced pork was a unique and delicious combination, and the fried frog in Bep Hen style was an absolute highlight! Every dish was flavorful and well-prepared. Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking to enjoy authentic Vietnamese food in Da Nang. Will definitely be back!

First time experiencing this restaurant
About the price: expensive, the food is not worth the price
About the space: all the dishes are chipped, this is a taboo in eating. I asked if there was any dish that was not chipped, then they brought it out. Ultr
About the service attitude: 1 star. The waiter did not respect the customers. Behaved in a joking manner. The customer was eating and you took the chopsticks away. Then the customer was eating and you took the tray back to clean up and politely chased the customer away.
The restaurant needs to be reviewed.

OMG OMG OMG. THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST FOOD WE ATE HERE IN DA NANG. 🤤🤤🤤
A MICHELIN RECOMMENDED RESTAURANT.

I gotta be honest here, the food isn’t anything special. I have absolutely 0 idea how they got onto the Michelin guide

1. Crowd control is bad, and people who were behind me managed to somehow get a queue number first. The people behind me in the cashier queue also managed to pay first.

2. The seats we got were on the third floor, and this made eating especially difficult when it was low chairs and low tables

3. Food was extremely disappointing. I ordered the braised pork, pickled fish in soup, tomato tofu, and stir fried morning glory.

Nothing was out of this world or even remotely close to that. Extremely ordinary flavours, and I’ve eaten at Tam Vi (a Michelin starred eatery which serves traditional food in Hanoi), and even while people already label that a tourist trap, I would consider that leagues above this place

Also 65,000 for a non chilled coconut is more expensive than more exclusive beach bars here

4. The way they gave out food was nonsensical. We got morning glory first, and followed by rice and I’m not sure how we are supposed to eat them singularly. I’m not expecting a world class experience but this was a dismay especially because the time they took to serve each dish was so long. They did apologise for that.

Great restaurant, nice atmosphere and awesome food. The portion sizes are big (2+ people size) and the pineapple juice was freshly made. Would definitely go again. Only improvement I can suggest is to use a little less oil. The morning glory was slightly too oily for liking.
Staff were lovely, and the food was incredible. I absolutely loved the fried shrimp spring roll. Would definitely go again and recommend!!!

I went with a Thai friend. It's said to be a famous restaurant even among Thais... We've both traveled to Vietnam many times, so we have a lot of experience with Vietnamese food. Honestly, only the Morning Glory in the photo was decent. The egg roll was salty, and the chicken was hard and difficult to eat. Being a poor traveler, I ate everything I could, but the pork and egg stew had a strong porky smell, so I left most of it...
This is my honest review.
Just a tourist restaurant~
Super tasty food, best in Danang 😊
A unique restaurant that claims to offer Vietnamese home-style cuisine and tastes like Korean food.

Had our best meal in Danang here!  The restaurant gives cozy home kitchen vibes and the dishes are tasty and are very good for sharing.  We particularly like the lemongrass fried frogs and fried tofu with tomato sauce.

Great food in this hidden gem, need few more drink options but food was appropriate to its Michelin recommendation
#genxplorers

The food was overall okay. However, I felt that it was a bit too ordinary for my taste, perhaps because it was Michelin and my expectations were too high. It seemed to be more geared towards tourists than locals.

Probably the most satisfying meal I had in Danang. It was so good I ate it twice!
Must order: fried shrimp spring roll, garlic and chilli frog legs, lemongrass pork belly.

Food was delicous, would recommend the braised pork belly with lemongrass!
The food was great. It has good flavour and taste. The portion sizes were great too.

Going alone, I was curious to experience what a Michelin-starred restaurant would be like.

- The service was okay, they were enthusiastic and honest, but unfortunately they didn't advise customers well about the dishes and the quantity to suit the number of people

- The food was fresh and delicious, not marinated before but cooked, the portion was large, the price was also very reasonable. However, the taste was normal, nothing outstanding, easy to eat.

- The restaurant space was decorated in the style of the old town, nostalgic and rustic, quite close and comfortable

- I ordered rau ma juice, the mix was sweet enough but not too sweet, just right for the taste

- Should go with 2 people or more because the portion is quite large
Delicious rice. Cool air conditioning.

The restaurant is decorated in an old-fashioned trading style, very nostalgic, airy space, friendly staff, delicious food. Every time my family comes to Da Nang, we eat here. The dishes we find the most delicious are orange ribs, braised pork with lemongrass and shrimp, grilled eggplant with scallion oil, and super delicious jute and shrimp soup.
The food really tasted amazing! Especially, the tofu with tomato
tasty
The food is really delicious and you can feel the essence of Vietnamese food. If you come to Da Nang, this is a place you must visit at least once. It's really delicious^^!!!

Orange tea is better than lemon tea, which has a lot of sugar. Lemongrass pork is the best dish, and the rest of the dishes are just average. The beef in the jasmine beef is marinated, and tastes like a 10% version of boiled beef. The jasmine is the vegetable flavor, with a slight jasmine flavor. The president is still very good. This is the best meal I have had in Vietnam so far
The restaurant has a lovely decor, full of Vietnamese culture that I had the chance to visit. The food is delicious and to my taste.
Vietnamese home-cooked meal~This is a place you can never visit on a package tour. It's so comforting.

We didn’t make reservations so did ‘open run’ at 5pm. All dishes we ordered so good except fried fishes. Easy to order menu with English dish names. Strongly recommend who wants to try Vietnamese home cook style. Pineapple juice was good too. Card payment available, surcharge 3% if you want to pay with card

A very quaint vintage shop that is reminiscent of my grandparents' era. I love it! I love all the retro n vintage stuff in there.  Old world charm.  We ordered too much - as usual - for 2 pax n 1 toddler. Must try is the stuffed eggplant. The portions were decent and the menu offerings were definitely different from the usual Vietnamese restaurants we've tried in Hoi An n Danang. Generally, the food has a light taste on the tongue n delightful. The herbs or seasonings are not overpowering.

Service was good,  just that sometimes it's hard to communicate but we all try to get by!

An old converted shop house decked out in antiques and nostalgic memorabilia. A very quaint vibe. Had no issues with Service and the food came reasonably fast. The stand out dish was the eggplant stuffed with minced pork. Everything was flavorful but could do with a tad less salt in some dishes.
Food was great, really tasty. Restaurant looks very nice.
Great name!
A beautiful historic place where you can taste typical Vietnamese dishes, very good at cooking and very kind waiters. I sincerely recommend it. 😋

The food and decoration is good, but the boys working here are rude. When I initially entered the surreptitious took photographs of me (I am white), giggling about their behaviour. I put my sunglasses on the table and one boy picked them up and tried them on to show the others. Despite the quality of the food I will not eat again in a restaurant where the service staff lack basic education like this.
Service was not nice, food also no, waited very long
Great food, convenient location!

Awesome from atmosphere to food

Worth the michelin commendation. Very local food done to a high level. Doesn't break the bank either.  We'll be back for sure. Thank you.

Had the frog , pork belly and shrimp spring rolls . All delicious . My first garlic frog and can’t say it’d be my go to fav Vietnamese but certainly worth it ! Fruit drinks were also a special . Nearly walked past the restaurant as garden type area out front hides the entrance a little at night . Loved our experience here and would definitely recommend .

I feel like my mom cook for me hahaha altought its not the same taste with my mom cooking and different county
The taste is delicious ans very comfort food. The restaurant ambience is like old home in vietnam

The staff also are very welcoming. At night are queing.
Loved the ambience, service was very friendly and food yummy
Nice atmosphere, environment and typical food
