Great cocktails and terrible Aussies

We give this place 5 stars for ambiance, food presentation and great customer service. However, their food was 60% great and 40% average. We ordered the meat platter. We really loved the smokiness and flavorful taste of the duck, we were hoping for the pork belly to be more crispy or have more flavor and the brisket was served cold and flavorless. Then we ordered the salmon, which we requested medium well done and was served well done. The taste was ok. The highlight for us was really their home made ice cream. We ordered the pistachio and the Cookie's and cream flavor. They were fresh and very creamy. It reminded me of the Italian Gelato. I want to give them the benefit of doubt that they were very busy since we went for New Year's Eve!
This is very good service

Nice restaurant by the river. Pretty affordable for the quality. We had the raw fish appetiser which was pleasant and the scallops were very well cooked. The yellowtail was pretty normal, nothing fantastic though. I would recommend their cocktails, they were excellent!

If you're in Da Nang but craving Da Nang fusion cuisine, this is a great option. Prices are higher than local restaurants, but cheaper than in Korea, and you'll get a decent meal. Credit cards accepted, friendly staff.
Lovely restaurant, great food and service. Just had spring rolls tarter and the BBQ pork ribs to share. Phenomenal, the pork melts in your mouth. Couldn't recommend Fatfish highly enough
Excellent food.
I visited because the interior was pretty and they said a French chef would do it, but it was clean and neat, but the taste of the food was... expensive by local standards.
This is a restaurant with a very atmospheric interior. The prices are average, but it seems like a good place to come for a special dinner.
It's expensive
Good presentation of food and a very nice setting. The pizza was excellent, I've tried 10-15 places for pizza in Danang and Fatfish shares the first spot with 2 other places for its perfection!
Absolutely lovely food and wonderful staff.Hope to get back to your lovely restaurant again.

Salmon fillet, Chardonnay
Tasty salmon steak after a long time
The garnishes are also great …
Creative cook of fish and beautiful furnished
Food was great but pricey. The restaurant looks great and the staff is great as well. For a touristy kind of venue the food is better than you would expect. But still, pricey.

Beautiful decor, friendly staff.
The presentation is impeccable and everything is delicious.
I recommend it.
A place with delicious appetizers and friendly staff.

The food was awesome, and the staff were just perfect, really. Get the ribs! Stupidly good, perfectly cooked. Wasn’t a fan of the Char Siu pork, the flavours were very good but I felt they tried to strike a balance of meat to fat that left …
Berry Good
I went there after seeing a blog recommendation and was truly disappointed. How could such a quality meal and price even get four and a half stars? I was hurt.
Visited twice on this trip,  both times we loved it,  I had pizza both times,  the lamb sausage,  and the Diavola, my wife had one pizza with zucchini,  and a vegetarian curry with black rice.
Amazing food! To try the red shrimps :)
Good quality food and drinks, especial the craft beers. A tad on the pricey side but the service was great.
Assorted seafood not good for the high price

Wonderful find. Very non pretentious entrance like walking off the beach into a bar in Costa Rica which opens into a bar / restaurant with beautiful decor. Obviously much though put into each detail.

Was offered the lunch menu available until 4pm and given the prices I thought it would be more of a snack. There were several options that sounded delicious and nothing over ten bucks. I went with the Mahi mahi sandwhich and was blown away at the massive piece of fresh fish I recieved. Went with the house made wedges (also have mediterainian salad and green salad options) and try as I did to finish I had to leave with two left on the plate.

A lot of great beer available but I went with the coconut shake. I work with a lot of breweries in Vietnam and drink it so often and well who doesnt love a coconut milkshake. Shake was great though pretty sweet.

Staff were wonderful. Chatty and attentative and big smiles.

Will go back tomorrow and try the in house smoked salmon bagel. House made breads a great touch.

Bravo, great spot.

Everything about the staffs are good. Excellent atmosphere and service, diverse and well presented menu, got a snack treat for a small beer, it’s a shame that I didn’t have the chance to order more to have a full experience here.

Tip for the house: a wider range of beers would be nicer.

According to the lonely planet, it's the highest rated restaurant in Da Nang. It was my friends wedding anniversary so we wanted to go for their special dinner. The restaurant looked clean and modern. Nice decor inside. Friendly staff. Nice ambience. View of the water could have been better. But the weirdest thing about the restaurant was the lack of customers. We were the only customers. There are 2 floors to this restaurant and all of the tables were empty. The food were reasonably priced. Not cheap, but not horrendous. The food tasted ok. Nothing to complain about. I guess for ok food and a quiet place to eat where you have the place to yourself, this is a good choice.
Amazong place! The staff is professional and helpful, and the food is fantastic. The fish is so fresh, and everything was spotless!
Really nice food and atmosphere, its classy yet informal. Great place to have a business meeting over lunch, and supurb views of the Dragon Bridge and Danang City
You must go to Fatfish if you are in Da Nang. Your mouth and stomach will thank you a million times over.
I had the duck with the mango salsa and it was amazing!
very delicious
The food was delicious and the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. The price range seemed more expensive than other restaurants in Da Nang...
Friendly staff, good food. Will be back for more dishes
Seafood pizza, seafood tomato soup & prawn red curry... WOW!
If you want quality, this is your match. It
Wow. We wondered in off the street with no research but the menu drew us in and it did not disappoint . The wine and food choices were great. Highly recommended.

Would I come back: YES!

Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5

The quality of this food was awesome in my opinion.  I had a very lovely meal here and would come back in a heart beat.  If you are looking for a non Asian meal this is the place to come!  The only thing I was confused about was the service charge...I didn’t leave a tip because of it since I assumed that was the gratuity.

Food:

Fish carpaccio: An interesting mix of ingredients which was very refreshing.  The combination of fruits with the fish complimented the fish.

Duck breast: Very well seasoned and cooked well.  The meat was fairly tender and moist.

Chocolate tart: More of a dense mousse in my opinion.  It has more a consistency of pot de creme.  Very rich and tasty.
Food was super tasty, service was great and the coconut coffee was fantastic! Atmosphere and general ambiance is very nice as well :)
Been chillin in Danang for years. Just hit up this joint and gotta say hands down great spot. Music hip, deco on point and staff mad chill and our new best friends!!! Much luv fatfish ronin(staff)!!!

Pros: nice atmosphere, fancy plates and good services, staff speak good English. The price is not too bad. They use bamboo straws, Danh Thanh sparkling glass bottles. The food in general is nice.

Cons:  Seafood is the wrong choice here. It tastes just average. We had a seafood platter and although the menu stated "lobster" in it, what they served us was not lobster but they insisted that Vietnamese baby lobster. And the chef put lemongrass  on that "lobster". The green chillies sauce is easy to find throughout Vietnam but here they made it quite bitter.
It's just expensive
Hoi An Ancient Town
Okay
It is a lovely restaurant  . Food is super fresh and delicious. I had the Duck Salad and Smoke Salmon Flat bread .  Staff are attentive  and premises are beautiful with clever recycled fittings  .

Such amazing food. Really loved the place and atmosphere. The staff were friendly and helpful, we were 10 ppl with small children and they were happy to help and accomidate. The drinks are stong and well priced. I highly recommend this place...
I felt the food was clean and neat.

Do not go here....you will only want to eat everything on the menu it is so delicious!

The food is fresh as can be, family owned. Excellant friendly staff who speak good English. The lady (We think she is the daughter of the owner) speaks good English and very helpful as all of the staff are.

Go between 4&6pm and have 2 for 1 drinks, cocktails and beer.

The beef and octopus carpaccio was sensational, the seafood tagliatelle......couldn't get enough of it...soooooo good.

We then ate the duck which is home grown literally as it comes from their own farm, same as the fish is supplied by their family as they are also fisherman.

In any case highly recommended,

Thanks to the staff and family at Fat fish Da Nang.

It's expensive by local standards. Never order the sirloin steak. It's expensive and extremely tough. I spoke to the staff, but they didn't give me any feedback. The portions were small, so I had to order several. The pizza was bland, and the ribs were okay. The salmon steak was delicious. The rest of the menu didn't suit my taste. I paid just under 100,000 won, and a tip is not necessary; it's calculated separately. The restaurant is cool and beautiful.
Really nice, the tap beer tasting plate is very good. The octopus carpaccio was delicious.
Very nice restaurant by the Dragon Bridge.  The duck dishes are excellent. I also enjoyed the Mahi Mahi.
Great food, nice selection of wine and the staff is very friendly. Went there 5 times in one week! Highly recommend this place
The medium well orange fish was still fishy, the pork rib was not grilled well, the bones were still red.

The decorations inside the store
What more needs to be said? I won't go.
The taste was just average.

I had grilled scallop salad, shrimp curry cocktail (Dorian Gray), and beer (Pilsner). The food was very unique and delicious! The portions were a bit small. The drinks were high in alcohol and average. The restaurant was cool and clean, and the staff were very friendly. The prices are somewhere in between Vietnamese and Korean. Of all the restaurants I visited in Da Nang, this was the most satisfying, and I'd love to go back again.
had an excellent seafood pizza. Very friendly and helpful staff, beautiful venue to enjoy the scenery at night.
The atmosphere is good and the plating is pretty :) But jonna is salty. Mul is also donbadayo ㅎ.ㅎ

Overall, everything was delicious~~ However, the portions were a bit small. The pizza, salmon steak, ribs, etc. were all delicious~!! I wish the sirloin was a bit more tender, but that was a little disappointing.
Wonderful experience: delightful food and best service. We had King Prawns and Bahn Mi, everything was delicious. Service great and huge wine list too.
excellent service and nice food..
Awesome restaurant with excellent pizzas and craft beer from Heart of Darkness brewery!
Amazing atmosphere. Definitely a place to visit in your travels. Had fresh watermelon juice that was soooo refreshing!
Delicious European food, beautiful location
Excellent service and hospitality from the moment they opened the doors to the free birthday dessert at the end. The food is savvy, not to be missed when visiting Da Nang!

Considering the cost of living, it is not cheap, but it is worth the price.

The taste of the food and the friendly service of the staff are both excellent.
clean and beautiful and good food
Enjoy high-quality Western food at 1/3 the price of Hong Kong. Great value. The ribs are well-cooked and delicious.
Amazing food, great staff. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!
Beautifully decorated restaurant, delicious food, reasonable prices.
The price is a bit expensive for Vietnam, but the taste is very satisfying.

Best food experience in Vietnam. European prices but you get what you pay for. Absolutely professional and smily staff, mouthwatering meals, excellent drinks. Extraordinary experience you are going to remember for years to come
Good sea food but not the greatest I've tried. The location of the restaurant is easily accessible and the staff is kind. The prices are a bit expensive though.

2 people came for dinner, total bill was => 700,000 VND
1. The dish tastes normal (only duck is ok)
2 sitting on the 2nd floor looking at the Han River is not beautiful because it is hidden
3. Food prices are too high compared to the Da Nang market
4. Craft beer is not very good
=> Not recommended
Beautiful setting, clean and wonderful service. Drinks were delicious!! We only had a calamari appetizer to eat but it was so tasty and fresh!! Very reasonable prices too!! Highly recommend.

Dinner at Fatfish was amazing, a group of six booked this fabulous restaurant via Facebook and weren't ducktoo sure what to expect....we have to say it was absolutely delicious!  For starters we had flatbreads then our mains were Seafood tagliatelle, red prawn curry, pork loin, pork spare ribs, chocolate tart with lemon curd, affogato with Bailey's, and the most delicious ice cream,  all just devine. Would highly recommend this place when in Danang. Special thanks to the fabulous staff who made our night, loved it!
Great place to eat, Fantastic service, best pizzas, awesome ribs etc 100% reccomended!
Great beer, wine, cocktails and dishes. The pork ribs were a highlight. Up-market vibe with great local produce and flavours
Food is outstanding

After 2 weeks in Vietnam and trying all kinds of food this place is definitely #1 so far. We had the beef carpaccio, blacked salmon and slow roasted ribs. Amazing food, good prices and a nice view for sunset next to the river. Great wait staff as well. Try this place, you won’t be disappointed!

This is an awesome restaurant and bar. So relaxed but very high quality food. They have Hendricks gin. Yum! The food was magnificent. We came here for dinner and drinks and then wandered a short distance down to the Dragon Bridge to catch the show.
Love the food and the premises. Menu full of delicious choices
The cost-effectiveness of the place next to Love Pier is...
Very clean and private space.
One of the most welcoming bar/restaurants in Danang. Craft beer,  locally brewed and fantastic food coupled with superior friendly service make this a 'not to miss 'place to visit.

On the slightly pricier side, but all of the dishes were great. Especially found the King prawn curry to be amazing. The octopus carpaccio was nice, but personally it felt that there was more tomatos than octopus. Background music was a tad loud, but as the food in general was decent, and the staff was pleasant, giving 5 stars.
Vegetarian curry is also great. Seems like the Signature dishes are all hits, and everything else is decent. Would like to visit again.
Great range of beers, and their smoked meats plate is pretty special.  Hit up the rooftop afterwards to see the dragon breathe fire.
Beautiful place. Highly recommended! In the heart of Da Nang. 😍 …

This restaurant is really excellent, I tried 2 cocktails and an appetizer, main dish and a dessert. I can really recommend the fresh fish in this reastaurant. It's pricey, yes, but very good as well. Will come again.
It's OK.  A bit expensive.  As for fine dining, it feels like it but not exactly the quality.  But ok
The BEST prawn curry I’ve had in my entire life. Thank you Fat Fish!!!!
Delicious and quiet
I don't know if it's my taste buds, but some of the food just didn't taste that good.
Nice place to be at if you want an unhurried dinner. Can go check out the Dragon Bridge after dinner.

Great food & cocktails delivered with such friendly service. I decided to have the King Prawn red curry & I wasn't disappointed! I enjoyed it so much I've already scheduled my next visit in the next few days. This restaurant is worth trying!!
The store is pretty, the food is delicious and they are friendly. The price is a bit high for Vietnam and the amount of food is small.

Avoid this place.  It is priced and marketed as a premium location for modern food.  Firstly, it is hot and airless, without functioning AC. Secondly the food is deeply average, while priced at Michelin levels.  I had a meal this evening …

Delicious sandwiches! The mahi mahi was
grilled  to perfection and served on fresh in-house made sourdough bread. The bread was soft and moist. …
Interesting food. Tasty, with lots of subtle notes, nicely presented; very ambient venue .

Good food. Happy Hour daily from 4 to 6 p.m. Nice owner who speaks good English.
Happy Hour daily from 4 to 6 p.m. The food is excellent.

Very tasty and quite expensive. But we were too lazy to leave, we decided to try something for the taste, not for satiety. Pizza with jamon (thin-thin) was charming, and the grilled meat plate too. The interior and atmosphere are beyond praise. But the highlight of the restaurant was the tap in the bathroom. The children found it and dragged us to look.

Amazing food. Quite expensive but a very good culinary experience. Altered the menu to serve our 3 year old daughter. Cocktails were spot on. Lovely location. Best dining experience for us in Da Nang.

Worth a try!!!
The service is extremely cute. The drinks are extremely delicious. The female bartender is very cute. And the food has no flaws. I recommend ordering Beef striploin and Sea scallop. Lovely restaurant. Will come back many times in the future.
Well, even though it's the weekend, there's no one.

Good food and good drinks! Not the place to go if you want Vietnamese cuisine but if it's not what you are after it is a great place to go. Cozy atmosphere as well as super nice service. And everyone were really good in English which is a big plus.
🇰🇷This is Spike. In my very personal opinion, the overall taste was good, I was grateful for the kindness of the staff, and I remember it as a place where I had an enjoyable dinner. …
Very, very delicious food, very friendly staff. Nice atmosphere. We were completely happy.
Very friendly Staff, Food is very delicious. Reasonable price. Recommended duck.
Excellent food, great service and fantastic ambiance. Wish I lived closer.
A must-go place~^^

So delicious cuisines, I had a 2 main dished, duck breast and salmon fillet.

I was totally satisfied with them.

All staffs are kind and sensitive.

They gave me a real good smile, not plastic.

And the food has a beautiful visual to give me a good appetitie.

Price is moderate, I guess,  300k - 400k vnd will be enough for 1 person.

The only bad thing is hard chair but it is a acceptable.

I hope enjoy your meal here.

P.S) The name of this restaurant is not 'Fattish', be carefull.
Very well done, one of the best restaurants I've been to. The duck was phenomenal. Wow. Would love to come back.
Classy riverfront restaurant with a lovely atmosphere and great food and service. We had a pizza and the pan seared sea scallops, both of which were superb.
Can't recommend for pizza. The quattro formaggi (four cheeses) had no tomato sauce and was not crunchy. Otherwise the place looked nice.
Very tasty and worth the price. Bonus: opened during TET and friendly staff
Everything we ordered is awesome!!!
Just Go~ You can eat by your eyes

An exquisite restaurant right on the river! It was so good, I've been back three times. Try the prawn curry and the duck with rice cake! Wow! Impressive place and lovely staff. Thanks so much team! You're on a winner!
The price is too expensive for Vietnamese standards and the quantity is too small.

Beautiful place with great beers, keeped me positive after the brewery i traveled to da nang for is closed douring their opening hours (7bridges). So lucky this place excist, serving some of the best beers in Vietnam Heart of Darkness. Pretty sure their food is great too. On the riverside. Friendly and awake service. Highly recomending this place.

The entire menu is delicious, especially the curry shrimp is really delicious.
But the amount is too small
Awesome Fusion restaurant. Great craft beer.
was really pleasant dinner with family, the plating was one of best and fantastic food taste :)) living in Thailand, wanna take flight to Danang to have this wonderful dishes!
Hands down one of the best restaurants in Danang. Beautiful, chic interior, friendly and personable service, and top notch food. Really recommend the scallops and beef striploin.
No Korean menu.
The food and cocktails here are delicious.
It's so tasteless and expensiveㅠㅠ
One of the best restaurant in Danang, great choice of fusion food.

We love this smashing, cool, friendly restaurant /bar. Our second night in our four day stay in Da Nang.  It's friendly, has great drinks including amazing Vietnamese craft beers, seriously good cocktails and the food is wonderful.  Oh and …

In the food (scallop dish), steel wool was served.
It was disappointing that they only said an apology without taking any action.

My husband and I came here for dinner on a Sunday evening, we had great service, the food was excellent (I had the Mahi Mahi which I highly recommend! My husband had the diavola pizza) our cocktails were great and we went up to the rooftop to watch the dragon bridge show at 9pm. It is a little more pricey then anywhere else we have eaten but well worth it and if we had the same meal back in Canada it still would have been double. They were friendly and it was great if your looking for a nice evening out!

I've been a regular customer at Fatfish since it opened, over three years ago. The are several reasons why I eat there. Firstly, the food and service are consistently excellent and dependable, with innovative new dishes available almost …

It looked so delicious that I ate it all as soon as it came out, so I don't have any pictures.

The owner is so kind, and the meat is really delicious~~
I was craving Korean food while visiting Da Nang, so I came to Jagaljip and had some meat and stew. I think I'll live a little longer... I visited with my kids, and they loved it too.

The kimchi noodle rolls are especially delicious. Be sure to order them too.

I was passing by hungry and found this restaurant by chance. First of all, it's clean and cool, the staff are friendly, and the food is delicious. It's so convenient because they cook everything for you. The price is also a good deal~♡♡♡ I found this restaurant.
The meat is grilled, so it's convenient and the food is delicious.
Very delicious!!!!!!! Cheap price, very good service. Kimchi cold noodles are very delicious.
Gravel House BBQ has a beautiful view and a cozy atmosphere. Truly one of the best Korean BBQ restaurants in Da Nang.
The pork belly was tender and perfectly cooked, so delicious! Even my daughter, who doesn't usually like meat, enjoyed it! If you're craving Korean food, I highly recommend Jagaljip!
The cool kimchi noodles at the gravity house are the best. Eating cool kimchi noodles in the hot weather made me feel cool.
It was so so so delicious. It was just like Korea. The kimchi wrap was perfect, and the kimchi stew had a lot of toppings and was so delicious.
I love the grilled dishes here; the meat is fresh and fragrant. Authentic Korean BBQ!
The BBQ at Gravel House BBQ is amazing, the meat is tender, and the seasoning is rich. 100% Korean imported meat – truly top quality!

They marketed it as "the meat served at its most delicious," and it was indeed delicious when it first arrived. However, because the grill couldn't maintain its temperature for long, it cooled quickly, and I ended up eating cold meat. Naturally, it became tougher as it cooled. It couldn't compare to the taste of meat eaten straight from the hot grill. Vietnamese customers who aren't familiar with Korean barbecue culture might enjoy it.

The grilled vegetables that took up the largest portion of the grill looked like they were just there to fill the table.

The kimchi pancake that was included in the set was quietly removed, apparently because they couldn't handle it. There was no explanation.

They advertised cold noodles or beer as an opening event, but as soon as I sat down, they started putting alcohol on the table, even though I didn't drink it. When I told them I didn't drink, they took it away. They could have replaced beer with another soda, but no cold noodles, no drinks... no options. Seeing that they didn't even give non-drinkers a choice, I felt they were inflexible.

Employee training is a key skill of the owner, but I was surprised to see him blame an employee in front of a customer when he was acting a bit awkward. He didn't realize it was spitting in his own face. ㅜ

When I paid, he didn't even ask how the food was, just a sullen expression on his face. I thought he was really bad at business. For a newly opened restaurant, he seemed incredibly unenthusiastic. I wonder if he wasn't curious about customer feedback.

It would be better to focus on the food selection and store management as much as he did on the interior and tableware.

The interior seems to have been carefully designed, and the ancillary services, like cold water and frozen wet tissues, are good. The only real concern is the food selection and customer service. The meat quality was decent, so it's truly disappointing.

I left this comment out of genuine frustration, but
it's even more disappointing that you don't even realize it's feedback. That's unfortunate.
I didn't just swear out of context.
You shouldn't be offended. Rather, I wonder why things weren't so good. Was it the food or the service? Most owners would have trouble sleeping because they're curious. Asking confidently and working to improve that area would be helpful in many ways. ^^
Delicious food, spacious, comfortable and clean restaurant 👌👌
Enthusiastic staff, ok food
Fast service, free refills on side dishes, enthusiastic staff
The restaurant is clean and the meat is grilled so there's no oil splatter, which is great. The kimchi stew is delicious.
If you've been offended by the local cuisine, come to Jagaljip and heal yourself. It's the taste of home. You'll have the best meal ever.
Located next to the Pink Cathedral. It was so hot that I came here for cold noodles, but I ended up having bulgogi in broth, which was even better than in LA. 👍

Today was my last day in Da Nang, so I went there to eat Korean food. It was clean and the owners were so friendly. I had a great meal and left feeling refreshed. They even gave me three free drinks. Thank you. I hope you prosper. I'll definitely stop by again next time I'm in Da Nang.
Delicious food, lovely service
The pork belly you eat in Vietnam is really delicious.

This is the first meal I've had during my trip to Da Nang...
I ordered kimchi stew and bibim naengmyeon.
The side dishes were delicious, too.
Free water, lol.
Thank you for the delicious meal! ^^

First time visiting the restaurant, overall it was okay. The staff was enthusiastic, the restaurant space was cozy. I went with my friend, my table ordered a meat set, black bean noodles and cold noodles, but all the dishes were salty. 
The restaurant also gave away mineral water and cold towels.

Once you enter, there aren't many seats, but it's clean and feels private!! The staff and owners are so friendly and always check on you throughout your meal to make sure you have everything you need!!

I ordered the pork belly combo, and the meat was all grilled and served warm, keeping it fresh throughout the meal!!
The grilled kimchi was delicious~!!!
The pork belly combo includes rice and stew, and we ordered the soybean paste stew. I asked for it to be a bit spicy, and it was delicious and spicy☺️

I hope this place becomes more popular by writing more reviewsㅎ☺️

It's a shame there's tax, but the meat is so-so. But the cold noodles and kimchi roll noodles are legendary. The best cold noodles I've ever had. The kimchi roll noodles are also perfectly shaved ice. Can't they do delivery?
Really good food
The meat flavor isn't that good. Honestly, I just missed Korean food so I ate it, but I'm 70% satisfied. The Jjapaghetti or something was overcooked.

This place is seriously the best!!!
You absolutely must try the soybean paste stew.
I thought my grandmother, who passed away in Vietnam, had come back to life...
This is my third visit to Da Nang. The food was clean and delicious today, too.
First meal in Da Nang!! Is this Korea or Da Nang? The staff are friendly and the meat is delicious!!

It was even more delicious than the pork belly I had in Korea! I ordered the pork platter, and three adult men were full. The side dishes were excellent, and the vegetables that came with the meat were delicious. ~
As a side note, there were no glasses in the room, but they lent me a soju glass. 👍 The owner and staff are all incredibly friendly! Highly recommended.
The side dishes are clean and delicious. The prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly, and the store is clean.
Among Korean restaurants in Da Nang, this one has the best atmosphere and service! If you're looking for a pork belly restaurant in Da Nang, this is the place.
Delicious food, reasonable price, enthusiastic staff, I will come back
The kimchi stew here was rich and hot, and paired perfectly with the meat.
The restaurant's atmosphere was stylish and modern, making it feel like I was in a real Korean restaurant in Da Nang.
I stopped by Han Market and was craving Korean food, so I stopped by this place. The meat is grilled, and the restaurant is clean and nice. It's delicious.
I was very impressed with the service at Gravel House BBQ. The staff were always friendly and attentive.
It's even better than Korean kimchi noodle soup. The pork is also excellent. Come here when you crave Korean food.

This is a restaurant I often visit in Korea, but on the last day of my Da Nang trip, I absolutely couldn't pass it up. I came right after the Dragon Bridge fire show! It was as expected. I had a delicious meal and left!!

Even though I go to a lot of delicious restaurants, I'm Korean...ㅜㅜ
Pork belly, kimchi pancake, kimchi stew, kimchi roll noodles...!
The portions were generous and it was delicious 🥰
Among the Korean restaurants in Da Nang, this one had a diverse menu and the staff were very friendly. I really enjoyed it~~
Delicious food, friendly service and staff, will come back next time
Ngonnnnn
Delicious food, portions are worth the price, free water and cold towels. Everyone should come and enjoy.
Authentic Korean food, I went in the evening and it was quite crowded, the staff was attentive, I will come back to eat ^^
Even though I paid in cash, there was an 18% tax added, so it ended up being much more expensive than I expected. It was more expensive than what I ate in Korea.
When I crave Korean food, when I'm a little tired of Vietnamese food, I eat perilla leaf pickles and kimchi stew, they're all delicious!
I had shabu-shabu at Mikazuki yesterday. It was incomparably delicious. The owner was friendly and had a great impression. Please sell a lot :)

This is the best food I've had in Vietnam. The owner and staff are all so friendly, and the interior of the restaurant is so pretty. The food is also delicious, and the vegetables feel so fresh. It's much more delicious than a typical Korean meat restaurant. If you're having trouble deciding what to eat for lunch or dinner, just go here. It's the best👍🏻

The grilled pork belly was delicious and odorless.
The owners and their husbands were very friendly.
Personally, I liked the set menu, but it included two servings of rice, so I regret not being able to try the charcoal-cooked fried rice. ㅠㅠ
I thought it would be more strategic to change the set menu to one serving of rice.
(You can order other menu items as well.)

I went to Hansijang and the air conditioner was really cool and the interior was clean and comfortable~~ I came here because I really wanted Korean food, and the side dishes, pork belly, and stew were all delicious ^^~
They grill meat for you and the prices are reasonable! The interior is also clean.
it is delicious

good food
good service
must try
The restaurant was very cool and clean, the food was the best I had in 4 days in Danang, Koreans should eat Korean food!

wow the new Korean restaurant has been open for a month, I had the opportunity to enjoy the delicious food. I really like everything from the food, staff, the price is very reasonable compared to many other Korean restaurants, I will come back many more times.

The first time I ate Korean food, I have to say that the food was very delicious, very suitable for my taste, 3 people were full for only 500k, cool space, friendly staff, delicious food, extremely clean, Korean restaurant owner so the food is authentic Korean, I will come back

Had the opportunity to enjoy Korean food at the restaurant, delicious food, extremely friendly staff, super fun restaurant owner, I really like the food at the restaurant, I will definitely come back 🥰🥰🥰

The restaurant is delicious, the portion is large for Vietnamese people, I am not very impressed with the panchan. A combo includes a set of meat as shown in the picture, a portion of soup, rice, panchan and 2 small mineral water (500k) the price is suitable for the portion, 2 people have a lot of food left. This set can be finished by 3 people, but for those who eat a lot, 2 people will be full. The space is clean, cool, spacious, but I don't like the smell of the restaurant very much, sitting for a while will get used to it but still suggest that the restaurant should handle the smell a bit. Although the mineral water is provided by the restaurant, it would be more delicate if the restaurant served it with a glass, going on a date and holding a whole bottle of water to drink like that, girls will be a bit shy and uncomfortable. The food here is tasty and the portions are very generous by Vietnamese standards. The side dishes (panchan) didn't really stand out to me, but overall the set was good value. One combo includes a meat set (like in the photo), soup, rice, panchan, and two small bottles of water, all for 500k. Honestly, two people will already feel full, and if you're not a big eater, this amount could easily feed three.

The space is clean, spacious, and cool, but I personally wasn't a fan of the smell inside the restaurant. You get used to it after sitting for a while, but I think it’s something the restaurant could improve.

One small detail: although bottled water is complimentary, it would feel much more thoughtful if glasses were provided. Especially on a date, drinking straight from the bottle can feel a bit awkward for some people.

If you're looking for a quiet and clean Korean restaurant, I highly recommend it.
It's a five-minute walk from Han Market.
The staff is friendly, and the food is clean and delicious.
The meat is fully cooked so it's easy to eat. The food wasn't bad either.
While looking for a restaurant near Han Market before leaving, I came here and had a delicious pork belly and stew. The portions were generous, the restaurant was clean, and the service was friendly.

This place gave me the joy of Korean food during my trip to Da Nang, when I was tired of eating only rice noodles, bun cha, and banh xeo. Stop by and get your Korean food fix. The basic set menu is incredibly good and delicious.

I visited last night! The restaurant is new, so it's clean and the meat was delicious! The meat is grilled and served hot, but they keep reheating it so it stays warm. Thanks to that, I enjoyed the meat warm until the very end. The taste was delicious and the portions were generous, which was surprising. Perhaps because the owner is Korean, the doenjang jjigae is very Korean-style. If you're looking for a Korean restaurant while traveling, I highly recommend it. The owner is also very friendly and fun, so I had a great time. If you're looking for a proper Korean restaurant, I highly recommend it.

I visited this place because I was craving Korean food during my trip to Da Nang.
The food was delicious, and the side dishes were plentiful, so it tasted just like Korea.
The owner was friendly, and the restaurant was comfortable and pleasant. I think it's a great place to come if you're craving pork belly during your trip to Da Nang.

I stopped by a pork belly restaurant near Han Market in Da Nang.
It's not a large restaurant, but the interior is clean and has a luxurious atmosphere.
I liked that the meat was pre-grilled, so I could enjoy it without worrying about heat or smell.
The Sapporo draft beer made the meal even more satisfying.
I recommend this restaurant to anyone craving Vietnamese food or craving clean Korean food!

Stopped by a small Korean BBQ restaurant near Han Market in Da Nang.
Though the place isn't large, it has a clean and upscale vibe.
The meat is grilled to perfection, so you can enjoy the meal without the usual BBQ smoke or smell.
If you're looking for a break from local food or want a more refined Korean dining experience, this is a solid choice.
Easy to find, traveler-friendly, and overall a satisfying meal.

I came here to have a glass of soju with samgyeopsal before finishing my trip. It was delicious and the owner was kind. The side dishes were fresh and I really liked the perilla leaves. It reminds me of the taste of my mother in heaven grilling samgyeopsal on a pot lid, wrapping it in perilla leaves, and putting it in my mouth when she came to visit. Please come here!

Beautiful interior
Delicious food
Pretty setting^^

The moment I took a bite of the kimchi roll noodles, I was confused whether I was in Vietnam or Da Nang, Gyeonggi Province. It was so refreshing and delicious. I keep thinking about it even as I write😭😭😭
Oh, and since there is swine fever going around in Vietnam, I haven't been eating pork, but the biggest reason I went to Jagaljip was that they don't use Vietnamese pork!! (This is something I'm very sensitive about these days)
Anyway, the meat didn't smell, was soft, and was very similar to the pork belly I had in Korea~
I went in without much expectation, but I've decided to go here for pork belly from now on

A Korean restaurant that I found at the request of my dad who wanted to eat Vietnamese mini pig samgyeopsal

Aside from my dad, no one else was hungry, so we ordered one set with 800g of meat, and the four of us ate it, which was enough.
The only thing is that there is an additional charge for adding vegetables, which is different from Korea!
I could see that the owner of the restaurant was Korean, and he asked me in detail if I was okay after eating, and he was very attentive.
I regret not asking if the pig was Vietnamese mini pig.

This restaurant will quench your thirst for Korean food while traveling in Da Nang. It's so clean and delicious. The meat is so tender and delicious. The charcoal-shaped fried rice is a must after eating meat. During the day, if you just eat kimchi roll noodles and cold noodles, the heat will disappear. The Vietnamese restaurants near Han Market are good, but eat the clean and cool kimchi roll noodles. It's the best^^♡ Vietnamese food tastes better if you eat Korean food in between. In addition, the tofu stew and spicy stir-fried fish are so delicious. Go quickly before you wait in line^^♡

Our first experience of fine dining in Da Nang.
A pleasant evening of Italian fusion with Vietnamese produce.
My husband is not a fan of seafood and they easily changed the set menu to accommodate his palate.
The wine pairing with the food was exceptional. I just wish I knew what each drink was so I could indulge at a later stage. The sparkling and pilot noir were delightful sips to the dishes.

The decor was beautiful.

The canapes to start with were delicious.  The Tomato Gazpacho was summer in my mouth.
The Salami Fennel Bruschetta, divine and the bread ..... wow.
The Rainbow Beetroot Salad fresh and delightful with each bite I took. I especially adored the yoghurt dressing and hidden Gorgonzola.
The BBQ Squid and Wagyu Steak were executed beautifully and the twist on the classic Tiramisu Dessert a wonderful way to finish the meal.

I loved the special touches in the female bathroom to help you freshen up from the hygiene products, tooth brush, toothpaste and mints.  Just the perfect touch.

Thank you for a memorable and delicious evening

We dined as a party of two.
We ordered 1 starter, 2 main dish, and 1 dessert.

Both the staff and the chef were so kind, and we were truly impressed!
Also, when we mentioned that we wanted to share the dishes (other than the dessert), they kindly served each one on two separate plates. The service was absolutely wonderful.

The prices were reasonable, and this has become one of the restaurants we’d love to visit again!
The tiramisu and the tomato-based gnocchi were especially delicious.
very good desert and excellent service
Excellent culinary experience. The best service in Danang. So pleasant, wonderful atmosphere and the food was pure awesomeness!

one of the best restaurants i’ve had the pleasure of dining in. if you like cheese, you HAVE to order their ravioli! everything we ordered was truly fantastic. staff were incredible too, so polite and helpful :) 10/10 recommend 🩷
One of the best dining restaurants in Da Nang that I have visited more than 10 times. The menu is diverse and very delicious. The staff are enthusiastic, attentive and remember customers.
Quite a local spot, suggest to order from seasonal seafood, reasonable price
An exceptional meal! Chef & his team are serving up some excellent bites.

Wow!
We had a wonderful birthday dinner here.
Delicious food, cozy ambience, great selection of wines and excellent service.
I was super impressed that when we said we are sharing, they served our food in 2 portions, all nicely presented.
Bravo! 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Lovely place for dinner in Da Nang. Portion is generous, well-priced and most importantly: delicious. Dessert was the highlight of my meal. Have to say the tiramisu and plum panacotta are the best dessert that I have tried so far, far better than dessert at 3 star Michelin in Singapore like Lesamis or Odette.
The wagyu beef is my second favorite dish. Good quality of meat and interesting choice of sauce which is so thoughtfully prepared.

Si Dining is one of the best restaurants in Danang. Amazing Chef Alessio Rasom from Italy creating fusion between Italy and Vietnam. Highly recommended. Well deserved MICHELIN Guide awards. Located in beautiful quiet neighborhood in Ngu Hanh Son District #littleitaly ❤ 🇮🇹 🇻🇳

This is one of the best fusion Italian restaurants I’ve ever been to. The service was excellent, and we had a really memorable time. Prices are fair, and the food was great. They gave us a small snack before the meal, which was a nice surprise. One of the sweetest moments was when the staff offered us Moscato to celebrate. I’d definitely recommend this place if you’re looking for somewhere to relax, celebrate, or just enjoy good food.

2025 review -
Came back again with family and the experience is still great. Restaurant managed to maintain its quality. My favorite dish is the baby lobster/ prawn. The mille feuille is a must try too!

2024 review -
Great dining experience! Food, vibe and services were superb. The 3 dishes we enjoyed the most are the pizza appetiser, beef steak and tiramisu! Ravioli was average but still not bad.
It has been an incredible experience, the dishes are exquisite and the pairing and advice from the sommelier have been amazing.

What an amazing first class dining experience.  Many of the food items were unlike anything I have ever tasted and absolutely delicious.  The wine was divine!  The service was over the top with the servers describing in depth every item we were served.  Chef Rasom also visited our table which was a nice surprise.  The food and drink is more expensive than most restaurants in Da Nang, however the experience and food is well worth it.  For a Michelin restaurant experience it is still 25% of what you would pay in a Western country.  HIGHLY recommend!

I don't rate this restaurant very highly, the food is okay, some are not, the noodles here are more like pho noodles, dry and a bit hard, my friend's fish was still raw, the restaurant apologized and gave me another piece of fish. Of the more than 4 dishes I ate, I only found the squid to be the best, I think it's called an Italian restaurant but it's kind of half-baked, half Vietnamese, I don't know about the rest. The service is also not very good. The space here seems romantic, not too noisy, easy to talk
For us this is the best restaurant in Da Nang. Superb food, perfect service and very nice ambience. Been here many times and many more to come.

Every trip to Hoi An must include a meal at Si Dining. This time it was super outstanding, such great quality and beautifully presented. Love the beats and outstanding service by Minh. The complimentary appetisers are a winner. Thanks Alessio
The food is delicious and unique. You should try the steak here, the beef melts in your mouth. The staff is very professional and enthusiastic!

We had the privilege of dining at this wonderful Michelin Guide restaurant, which offers a truly unique Italian menu. It was a delightful surprise as it was much more contemporary than traditional, with a clever Vietnamese-influenced twist that felt fresh. The tropical ambiance created the perfect backdrop for our meal.

We started with three exceptional dishes: the kampachi ceviche, langoustine, and an incredible oyster, abalone & snail salad with green beans. For our mains, we enjoyed the pigeon prepared two ways and the savory A5 Wagyu beef. Every single dish was perfectly balanced, with no single flavor overpowering another. It was a truly memorable experience.
I highly recommend the oyster and abalone starter(total standout) and be sure to order a carb to complement your meal.

What an extraordinary experience. It’s like a food journey, Started from the sea, up in the air, back to the sea again and then land and then north pole melting ice, took 2:30 hours to complete. The wine pairing is one of a kind too. This is my second time here, never disappointed.
Absolutely fantastic experience. I’d send any of my friends or my enemies to Si for dinner in Danang, because everyone should be able to experience the lamb ragu and tiramisu.

Update: We came back(5 times) and this place truly impressed us with food and their customer service. I changed my rating to 5 stars.

Food

- We chose the 8-course signature menu. While most dishes were unexpectedly flavorful, the last three courses were mediocre. The ravioli had a well-seasoned filling, but the outside was too firm; an additional 30 seconds of cooking might have improved its texture. The spaghetti dish was disappointing, resembling standard spaghetti found at many restaurants. The final savory course, pan-seared pigeon with tamarind sauce, lacked the expected sourness, tasting predominantly sweet. However, I admit that the meat was perfectly cooked.

Service
- While the food was generally impressive, the service did not meet expectations, especially considering the premium pricing. Throughout the dinner, I wasn’t asked if i wanted another beer, and my water glass remained empty until I requested a refill multiple times. This lack of proactive service detracted from the overall dining experience. Thats why i gave it 4* but there is room for improvement.

Location
- The restaurant is off the grid but it only takes 15 minutes to get there from downtown.

Overall, i did like the food. i would recommend this restaurant to my friend and definitely come back in the future

Our first dinner in Da Nang and it certainly did not disappoint. The restaurant is small and cozy but with an excellent chic ambiance. Perfect for date night. The staff is well trained and coordinated, and very attentive. After some complimentary welcome bites from the kitchen, we enjoyed our starters and mains. The food is impressive Italian executed on a true fine dining level, but with some creative fusion touches. It’s done very well. I personally loved the prawn salad with peach and lemon. We were impressed by the taste, presentation, creativity, and generosity from the kitchen.

At the end of the meal the chef came out to greet us and we had a nice chat. They are doing everything right at this restaurant, hope they keep up the good work! A great team effort overall from everyone here. Would love to dine at Si again if we return to Da Nang.
Excellent food and service, especially the lasagna — simply outstanding!
The restaurant is quiet, with 2 spaces for everyone to choose from. The food is delicious, beautifully decorated, the taste is quite unique and special.

A very disappointing restaurant for the price paid.

Food: 2⭐️
Service: 2⭐️
I came to the restaurant with a friend and had booked a table for 2 people. When checking the table with the staff, the staff took me straight to a table right at the kitchen entrance in the lower area with no customers and very hotgggg. When I asked to change the table, the staff did not tell me that there was an air-conditioned room upstairs and all the customers were dining there. My friend had to go up and check and request a table change. While there was no full table upstairs and no table had a reserved table card. Second, the other tables (mostly Western guests) all brought out a bamboo basket for the guests to put their bags in, but our table did not.

About the food, I did not expect the best dish of the whole meal to be the restaurant's welcome food. Except for the tomato soup (exactly like crushed tomatoes), the 2 welcome dishes were delicious and unique. But why did you serve the starter with the welcome dish, while I ordered grilled squid as the starter, when I used the squid it was already cold, and a bit fishy. Do you understand the exact timing of serving each dish in turn, especially for fresh seafood dishes. The most important thing is that you combined fresh squid with mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes that I thought were sweet potato pudding, were super sweetttt, and it didn't go well with the squid dish at all, it broke the entire texture of the dish, I was eating fresh squid, salty with black garlic and then eating a whole piece of sweet potato pudding that was both sweet and greasy with the smell of milk. It was too sweet to be served with a savory dish whether it was squid or chicken.

You are a restaurant specializing in European cuisine but you cook mashed potatoes like sweet potato pudding. You are so creative.

The food is normal, fresh, but not wow enough for the price I paid for you. It didn't leave any impression that made me remember and want to eat it again.
The last thing you do when you send emails asking for customer feedback is when you don't respond to customer feedback. My friend replied to your feedback request and waited for more than a week but still no response, sent again a second time and still no response. So do you respect your customers or not?

We celebrated our anniversary here. The space is super suitable for dating. The service is very nice. The restaurant also gave us a free dessert for our anniversary. The food has pork cooked in 3 ways, which I find the easiest to eat.

I had the chicken with truffle done two ways — both absolutely delicious — and the server recommended me a glass of Nebbiolo, is very nice pairing. The wine list has some real gems, and while the prices are on the high side, the quality and attention to detail in both the food and service make it feel justified. You walk out lighter in the wallet but happy with the experience.

Stunning decor in a jungle like setting, lovely well presented food and very friendly and attentive staff.
Interesting Euro Asian fusion with amazing flavours.

a charming little hideaway perfect for date night—quiet, cozy, and with easy parking (so no pre-dinner stress!). The staff are lovely, the lamb ragu pasta is heavenly, and the tiramisu… dangerously addictive.
There are many delicious dishes such as smoked salmon or salmon eggs with rich flavor.👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

I am writing this review after I put my comments in your feedback form, and I receive nothing (almost 1 week from now). Maybe you are so busy I guess.

I do not claim anything, I just want to share my thought. I made reservation for two, and we came on time. It was a very hot day in Da Nang (one of the hottest day), as you may experience. I am not sure why your staffs took us to an aisle seat downstair, without air condition. They did not advise that the restaurant has air condition room upstair. I must ask them if there is another table up stair, and I have to go to check by myself. How can we enjoy our dinner in such hot place. And I am really really disapointed since I have booked the table, I prepared from my end to enjoy your food, but you destroyed it.

We ordered 1 starter, two main courses, 2 deserts. I am not sure why you serve welcome bread as the same time with starter. We wait for while, and the a bunch of food is served. It does not make any sense for me.

From my point of view, the food is just fine for me, not so surprise. The only thing I can remember is the masked potatoes used in the main course because it is too sweet.

Thanks.

This restaurant has the most stylish exterior and interior design of any restaurant in Da Nang that I've seen so far.

It looks like it could be in Daikanyama, Tokyo, and is filled with tranquility, elegance, and sophisticated adult style.

Because of its ambiance, the main clientele seemed to be those on special dates like anniversaries or small dinner parties.

The local customers were dressed in their finest attire, and the international customers were all calm and composed, so you can enjoy your meal in a refined atmosphere.

I ordered the main dish a la carte, and my impression was that it was not particularly delicious, but rather had a smooth flavor.

Given the restaurant's reputation, price range in Da Nang, and the restaurant's appearance, expectations are likely to be high, so I think judgments of the food will vary.

The restaurant costs around 6,000 to 9,000 yen, which is very reasonable considering the ambiance, and the food is reasonable, in my opinion.

The wine menu is extensive and delicious, so I personally recommend focusing on enjoying the wine and enjoying the food as an accompaniment.

The service level is high, but although there are several wait staff, none of them have a full view of the entire restaurant, which can make ordering difficult.

The restaurant's relaxed atmosphere makes it difficult to call for staff.

I've written a lot, but I think this is the perfect place to forget you're in Vietnam, spend a special time in a stylish space, and enjoy some wine.

Thank you! It was a delicious meal 😋
Top restaurant!! Italian chef with a nod to Asian cuisine. High-quality food with surprising combinations. Truly courteous and knowledgeable wait staff. Exceptional place. We'll be back!
The restaurant is very beautiful, the service is 1000 points, everything is satisfactory. My fav restaurant in Da Nang 😘
I ended up going again. Because it was so delicious. Morning Glory was even better than other places. It's a taste I'll miss even when I go back to Korea.

For dinner, we ordered à la carte. They said the portions were large enough for two people to share, so we shared dishes like Red Tail McKerell sashimi, lamb tartare with pecorino cheese, and LẠC SƠN chicken with black truffles. It seemed like a perfectly balanced portion for one person, but we still ended up full.

The food was delicious, but for a Japanese palate where fusion is the norm, there was nothing particularly new here. It felt like the chef's personal take on Italian, French, and Vietnamese cuisine.

The amuse-bouche was pickled vegetables, and the use of miso and other seasonings, along with the sashimi techniques, all had a strong Japanese influence, so perhaps that's why there weren't many surprises.

The food wasn't too expensive, but the wine was significantly more expensive than in Japan, so we opted for something on the cheaper side. It came to around 15,000-16,000 yen for two people, so unless that was your main focus, I wouldn't recommend it.

Of particular note are the excellent service and the layout of the store. Such attentive customer service is rare, not only in Vietnam but even in modern Japan, and the semi-open-air building, hidden amongst trees on the outskirts of a residential area, is definitely worth a visit.

I've said a lot, but overall I was very satisfied.

One of the best dining experiences I’ve had while traveling!
The pasta was fresh and flavorful, the wine pairing was spot on, and the service was warm and professional.
I was so busy enjoying everything that I forgot to take any photos — which says a lot. Definitely a highlight of my trip!

The place offers an innovative blend of Italian and Vietnamese flavors, crafting unique dishes with fresh, local ingredients. Its romantic, nature-inspired setting and attentive service create a memorable fine dining experience.

• Style: Modern Italian cuisine with a Vietnamese flair
• Atmosphere: A sophisticated and tranquil setting along the Han River
• Recommended for: Romantic dinners, anniversaries, and gourmet dining
• Cuisine and Menu: Under the direction of Chef Alessio Rasom, who has over 20 years of experience in Michelin-starred restaurants worldwide, the menu changes daily with the seasons. Authentic Italian flavors are blended with fresh Vietnamese ingredients, and set menus like Si Classic and Si Nature offer a sophisticated and diverse culinary experience.
💯 Points… 🤩 So, so delicious 🤤

In a nutshell:
Service: Well trained
Food: Tasty and creative
Atmosphere: Premium feel perfect for a date

When we arrived we were immediately greeted and seated at our table by service team. After ordering, we had nice appetisers that came together with our drinks. We had a nice Italian wine recommended by the chef and it was perfectly paired with our dishes.

The food was excellent and really tasty. We were 3 guests and we ordered a few starters and main courses to then be shared among us. Every dishes were pre divided in 3 plates and served to us. That was a really nice touch. The combination of Italian and Vietnamese flavours makes the food really special. For instance, the Ravioli filled with Gorgonzola cheese was enjoyed by all our table.

Finally the atmosphere is really nice. Firstly the music is at the perfect volume. They have beautiful artworks that surrounds the room tastefully.

Thank you to all the team that made that dinner special!

No good taste with very high price.
Couldn’t understand it is Itallian food.

It’s the kind of restaurant you spend a fortune and go to McDonald’s after because you are still hungry. The best parts were 1. Impeccable service worthy of Michelin star. 2. The free food at the beginning. 3. The wine.  However the starter and main course were lacking in seasoning, texture and just general balance to the dish. You would have better street food for 60k dong and I spent 2 million here . The fish in my main course was over cooked, had there been vegetables or other accompanying items this may have been less noticeable, but just this and and under seasoned sauce was highly underwhelming. I would not return and I believe the Michelin recommendation is unfounded.

They have truly outdone themselves and blasted my expectations out of the roof.
Was definitely not expecting to have the best Italian food outside of Italy.
The kind servers even had excellent attention to detail and asked if the food was for sharing and got the kitchen to portion and individually plate each dish for each person. Food was spectacular.

A wonderful evening at Si Dining with delicious handmade ravioli, perfectly filled and bursting with flavor. Paired with a smooth Italian red wine, it was a cozy and authentic Italian experience. Warm service and a lovely atmosphere made it even better.
100% local Vietnam ingredients (except for truffle). We had a really pleasant night. Would definitely come again.

Service - The waiter is very meticulous in understanding what our needs in food. The hospitality is good.

Environment - Serenity comes! The ambience is good and relaxing. Suitable for a date and deep talk.

Food - Taste is good and well-matched!  The langoustine and beetroot salad are the favourite🥰.

Price - Reasonable price.

An exceptional fine dining experience. The food was not only delicious but showcased incredible attention to texture and presentation. Every dish was thoughtfully prepared — from the perfectly balanced flavors to the elegant plating. The atmosphere was sophisticated yet welcoming, and the service was attentive without being overbearing. Absolutely flawless from start to finish — a must-visit for anyone who appreciates quality cuisine

Top of the tops for contemporary Italian
Recommended dish is trio of FRUTTA E PESCE (not in menu) see pic
regards j
It's stylish, delicious, quiet, and a great restaurant. It's perfect for entertaining.
Should get one Michelin start
There are places that don't need much introduction. Si's House is one of them, delicate enough to remember, quiet enough to want to come back.🎀🫶🏻

A Michelin-level restaurant with signature presentation and good service. Please note that the prices are appropriate.

I took the "set for 1", was very pleased, the duck and desserts were very tasty. The salad was an acquired taste with beetroot)
Food and service were 10/10. Every dish (including dessert) was so well balanced and perfectly cooked. Ambience could be better with livelier music. Still, highly recommended! 💯

A Standout Dining Experience in Da Nang
As a restaurant owner with 28 years in the industry, it takes a lot to truly impress me — but Si Dining exceeded all expectations. The balance in each dish was exceptional, with beautifully refined Italian cuisine elevated by subtle Vietnamese influences. Every plate showed technique, thought, and heart.

The hospitality was just as memorable — warm, genuine, and professional. You can feel the pride in both the kitchen and front of house.

A world-class dining experience — Si Dining is a must-visit in Da Nang.

A wonderful Italian restaurant with a creative Vietnamese twist. Every dish is made with fresh local ingredients, and the service is incredibly attentive. A great dining experience! The wine list is expertly curated.

You don’t stumble into Si Dining by accident. Hidden on a quiet Da Nang street, this place glows with warm light and just the right amount of anticipation. Chef Alessio Rasom’s menu reads like a love letter to both Italy and Vietnam—think imported cheeses and housemade pastas, but also Đà Nẵng’s own rau răm and Lý Sơn garlic woven into every dish.

Start with the Gambero Rosso Carpaccio: red prawn, sharp pecorino, a taste of summer on a plate. Or try the Snail & Abalone Salad with green apple and granita—a briny, bright snap for your palate. For mains, the Gnocchi Sweet Potato with tender lamb brasato is comfort food with a twist, while the Linguine Octopus with capers and olives brings a briny, Mediterranean punch.

Don’t leave without dessert. Whether it’s cloud-light Tiramisu or Cannoli Calamansi, each ending is as thoughtful as the start.

Pro tip: ask for a wine pairing—the sommelier knows every bottle’s story.
• Vibe: Modern Italian, never fussy
• Price: $$$ (mains $16–$29 USD; tasting menus from $50 USD)
• Must-try: Gambero Rosso Carpaccio, Gnocchi Sweet Potato & Lamb, Cannoli Calamansi
• Accolades: Michelin Guide Vietnam 2024, Robb Report’s Top 25
___
Si Dining Italian Restaurant
1 Giang Châu 2, Khuê Mỹ, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng

#HyperrrLocal #DaNangEats #VietnamFoodGuide #LuxuryDiningVietnam #DaNangRestaurants #FineDiningVietnam #HiddenGemsVietnam #TasteOfVietnam #WhereToEatDaNang

This is fine dining at its best. Every dish is like art. Every bite takes you on a new vacation. The wine is sensual. Staff is friendly yet professional. And the best of all is the owner Alessio who is a passionate Chef. Thank you for a wonderful anniversary!

Everything here was wonderful, from the ambiance, music, to the food. i really liked the design of the place. i'm usually very picky about food, but I managed to eat the entire set menu. The staff recommended a delicious champagne, though the tiramisu dessert wasn't very impressive. I quite liked the BEEF RIBEYE MB9+ and 'Cam', will comback ~
chicken is really soft and the soup of chicken, also some dishes included vietnamese style which is beyond some traditional, all is tasty

I went here with my boyfriend to celebrate our 200th day together. The food was delicious, of course, and the service was amazing! We both ordered the most expensive course and were very full. I definitely recommend it.
Our evening at Si was faultless. The food, waitstaff and atmosphere was exceptional. Whole family was blown away. Highly recommended.

we had a great night here enjoying dinner with friends. the restaurant is located in a quiet area with professional settings and great services. the foods supplies were selected from local sources in the day and the menu is not confirmed before 4pm. the staff were also very nice and well trained.

Happy to find Danang has a place like this. A leafy spot near the lake, decorated with art, serving food that's full of heart, made with the best ingredients from this part of the earth. Chef Alessio and his team put so much passion and thought into each aspect of the experience at Si Dining. Go (and don't forget to treat yourself to the vanilla gelato - it's heaven!)

We’re so glad we found this place by chance!
The chef gave us a warm welcome, and the whole team was friendly and attentive.
The ambiance is relaxed and chill, with greenery decoration—and no mosquitoes, which is a big plus!
The menu changes daily based on the fresh seafood available, offering a unique blend of Italian inspiration and Vietnamese ingredients. That combination is definitely the standout feature here.
We’ll definitely be coming back and recommending it to our friends!
Very good atmosphere and service. The food was quality

Lovely upmarket restaurant in a quiet street.

This upmarket restaurant serves interesting, high quality meals. Strong winelist, and professional waitstaff. Serving size is generous. Refined, quiet atmosphere. We ordered a la carte. My wife ordered 'fish of the day' for main, which was red snapper, fresh and superbly cooked (still moist, not tough as snapper often becomes when even slight overcooked). Cost is slightly higher, but v good value for this type of restaurant. Easily 5 stars. We would happily return. Hamish.

Best tiramisu ever!
The car helped us to get out of the rain (on a rainy day) when we got off the car
We also sent WhatsApp messages on the day to let us know what we needed to pay attention to
This was the most rewarding part of our entire trip to Vietnam!

Fantastic meal.
The chef is a genius. Ordered few dishes and all of them are great. The taste of the dishes are so refined.

Dessert mille fueille is a must try

If u have only a few meals in danang, this place is a must go.
Beautiful space, great experience to enjoy. Highly recommend the food experience and service.
Réal fine dining, stunning experience, exquisite taste…… I have no word but  I keep souvenir…. Thank you Chef

Amazing Surprising
Everything is perfect
Thank you Chef for all the surprise you give us
highly recommended

I had a truly wonderful dining experience at Si Dining this evening—just as impressive as my previous visit. What I love most about this place is how the chef transforms familiar ingredients into dishes that are both creative and uniquely memorable. Each plate reflects a distinct personality, yet feels comforting and approachable.

Beyond the food, the service really elevated the evening. I appreciated having the privacy to enjoy my dinner while still feeling cared for at just the right moments.

Si Dining is a place I would proudly recommend to any friend visiting Da Nang!
The restaurant has a quiet and separate space. Professional service.

25 years later, we revisit and update!
I missed it for a long time after I ate it last time
It can be said that I came back to Danang just for this restaurant.
The service is still meticulous and the food is even more amazing
I like it more than last time...

I tasted a lot of Taiwanese elements, such as pig blood, black garlic, and dried mushrooms.
The way it is integrated with the food is very novel
Every dish is eye-opening and amazing🥹
If you are not used to eating Western food
They have a Vietnamese flavor, which I think is quite similar to Taiwanese cuisine.

Four dishes, two desserts and two drinks cost about NT$2,600
Eat this meal in Taiwan
Such great taste and service
It might cost more than twice the price haha

A very satisfying evening!
Thanks again for this great restaurant 😍

Thank you si dining for giving me an unforgettable anniversary
Every dish is super delicious
Some of the seasonings are something I never thought of.
It's so romantic to eat in a semi-outdoor environment while watching the palm trees swaying
The decor, service and food are all the best
like!

I can’t say enough nice things about this restaurant. The food is unbelievably delicious and well prepared. The chef and the staff are friendly and personable. I’ve been lucky enough to enjoy some outstanding meals in my lifetime. This is among the best.
Can’t fault it. Interesting menu in a very stylish space, well away from the tourist crush.  Every fish was a delight.
World class menu

This place is simply amazing. The atmosphere is intimate, the lights are dim and it's quiet all around. Great service, attentive staff. It's really nice that they bring free snacks. The octopus pasta was one of the best I've ever tried. I recommend visiting!

Absolutely incredible restaurant. I celebrated my birthday here and the staff were so kind, knowledgable and patient. The food was amazing and the quality for the price was truly outstanding. I really loved the space too, very intimate and romantic, but elevated. Thank you so much for a phenomenal birthday meal🤍 …

What a nice place to go for a date or family dinner !!!

Quiet restaurant, there are 2 spaces for everyone to choose. Delicious food, …
Everything was just perfect!

This place reminded me of the hospitality experiences I'm used to providing back home in Canada. High class, relaxed environments with a beautiful, natural aesthetic and very hospitable, knowledgeable, and helpful staff. The food was …
Comfortable environment, high quality food, fresh ingredients, friendly and considerate service attitude

Starting with excellent service and ending with a delicious dessert. We had an excellent evening to celebrate our 20th anniversary thanks to the staff at this incredible restaurant.  The dishes were presented well and the flavours were …
cuttlefish is the best. It's a pity that the more I eat, the less food I have.
Excellent food in a beautiful restaurant and knowledgeable and very friendly and welcoming staff.
Very good place for the ambience and food! Would recommend the set as it was super worth it! Staff was very attentive and perfect place for a date

I honestly think it's the best restaurant in DaNang. Amazing food, great wine, beautiful atmosphere and last but not least very attentive and professional service. I've been there a few times already and I've always had a wonderful experience. If you're looking for a place for a special occasion or even if you just want to treat yourself nicely, don't look any further. Highly recommend.
Food, space, service are all ok. Many local, unique ingredients.

So Dining created an unforgettable dining and proposal experience for us. My partner chose this restaurant to propose at and I can honestly say I was loving everything about this place even before the surprise proposal happened.

The staff service, food, ambience - attention to detail was in everything.

And our server Mimi was just the best, she is a huge asset to this establishment with her genuine and warm service. She was instrumental in keeping everything a surprise and helped my partner with all the details.

Thank you Si Dining for being a part of our milestone moment and making it unforgettable.
Ideal date place for couples with great European dishes ✊

Hidden in a quaint part of Danang, we were mesmerised when we stepped into the restaurant.

Food was true to be said, fusion of Italian and Vietnamese flavours and we were intrigued by this wonderful matrimony.

Service was stupendous, the team moved with grace and were very welcoming. Their food knowledge reflected the great work behind the scene, and it was commendable.

Lastly, the little touch in the washroom amazed me and it showed how thoughtful the person behind this is. We truly enjoyed ourselves tonight and thank you for the wonderful experience!

We ordered the more expensive signature set meal. Many of the dishes have unique and novel seasonings (there are some ingredients that are relatively rare in Asian cuisine). We really like the sauces and juices with mulberry and citrus, which are also super delicious!
The lobster and pigeon are great😍😍😍The taste and presentation of other meals are also outstanding~
I ordered two set meals, and one of the desserts was very considerate and allowed us to change it to a different item from the menu🥹. I highly recommend the tiramisu!!! It is a towel roll. The bitter chocolate outer shell and the cream inside are very refreshing and not burdensome.
Every service staff is friendly, professional, and very attentive. They will change the tableware, tidy up the table every two or three dishes, and will also ask if the taste is OK. There is a male waiter wearing glasses who carefully explains the preparation method, seasoning, eating method, and pairing wine every time he serves the dishes. Thank you very much!
When making the reservation, I made a special note that in order to celebrate the anniversary, I originally thought that the table would be decorated with bouquets, but I didn’t expect to receive a small cake🥺🥺🥺 and a complimentary glass of pairing wine for dessert (it was very sweet and delicious). It was such a surprise🫶I also kindly helped to take a group photo. I am very grateful for a very novel, rich and warm experience today🥰~
It is recommended that everyone come to Da Nang to eat at this restaurant. In addition to set meals, there are also many a la carte options to choose from!

I think much better then comptoir
Who are good to but Si is much better
Great wine list veryyyy good staff owner nice Although he is italian
Sommelier highlight of the restaurant
Bit on the bad side is like a dictator
Don,t go against her

The owner did once
And lost all his hair

We love the food and the friendly staff here. The staff was particularly thoughtful and helpful as we had our 4 years old daughter with us. We were  given a free dessert because it was exactly our daughter's birthday that night, which she loved the most.  We will definitely return next time!

Super nice atmosphere, very friendly and open staff.
We were warmly welcomed and the food was very tasty with fresh local ingredients.
Definitely a recommended lockal.

Dinner with my wife: We ordered sauteed black pork, but the chef said it wasn't up to par, so we served beef liver steak and fillet steak. Everything was delicious, and anyone coming to Da Nang should definitely try this place.

as an Italian and traveling abroad by bike for more than two years, having dinner in Alessio's restaurant I felt as if I were at home with just a forkful of food! I loved everything, attention to detail, the warm and welcoming environment, the dishes, the great work and kindness in the service of the waitresses! In Da Nang you definitely can't go wrong to come here to eat! Thank you so much Alessio also for the nice chat between people and cycle travelers! A hug and all the best for your future!

I guess I don't understand anything about fine dining. But when ordering pasta with lamb, you don’t expect any gristle on the stones in it. I thought my teeth were crunching. (not eaten in the photo) In general, it painfully reminded me of navy-style pasta with beef stew from a can. Those who remember will understand. But at a much higher price. Free welcome treats are fine. Thank you! Czech beer is also okay. The service is a bit intrusive. In general, everything is great here. But don’t set foot here again.
P.S. In response to the slander of the restaurant, I will say that I pointed to the plate right there and said that the food was no good, when an employee approached me and asked if I liked everything. No action was taken other than strange looks. Even at the time of my payment they just looked at me. No one gave even the slightest hint of a desire to understand (not even solve) the situation.
I brought the cartilage with me - you made my day. )))) And I brought stones. Before that, I had only seen this on TV, which I haven’t watched for twenty years. Good luck with this approach to things.
P.P.S.: Before this I doubted it. Perhaps this is the norm. And I even chewed the first cartilage. But now it has clearly become clear that cartilage and stones are not part of the dish. And someone's sloppiness.
P.P.P.S. There is no point in writing me pompous terms and names of ingredients. I described my taste sensations. For me, it's beef stew from a can.
And the Indian Old Monk rum is for me Moskovsky cognac.

Thank you for having us tonight, Alessio.
All dishes were so special and delightful.
It brought us to the paradise with every single bites.
We got full of energy to keep cycling to Hanoi.
Thank you so much. :)
The food, service, atmosphere were all fantastic. It was our favorite restaurant during our trip to Danang! Literally everything we ate was absolutely delicious.

Wonderful delicate dinner in a peaceful setting. Be careful, we are not in an Italian restaurant here. We cook cuisine with Italian flavors enhanced with Asian flavors. We feel all the attention paid to the dish and the work with the raw materials. This evening will remain an excellent memory and my best culinary experience of this trip.

Food was great, although somewhat small portions. Vibe is very 'tropical upscale'.  Venue is just outside the busy areas, so nice and peaceful. Food pricing seems appropriate for the experience. Great for a date or anniversary. Wine and drink options are kind of pricey.
The atmosphere of the restaurant was outstanding, the food was top-notch, and the staff was so nice that we could say that they were the best in Vietnam. I want to go again.

Food was great, wine pairings too!
My scooter ran out of battery after dinner and the owner took care of charging it the next morning and communicated with me through whatsapp. Very helpful!

I knew the menu changed seasonally and seasonally, so I visited.

(I visited because it had a Michelin star. However, it won't be awarded in 2025, and it's just a guide. Of course, that's a great thing.)

I knew the prices for the signature course and wine pairings were steadily increasing.

But when I visited in March 2025, the price of the course had also increased significantly, making it seem like a wasteful eight-drink pairing, making it less attractive compared to fine dining in Korea. Nevertheless, I made a reservation and ordered.

However, they were quite adventurous.
