The best unexpected restaurant

I think this is truly the best steakhouse in Da Nang. Ordering a 400-gram large steak + Bolognese pasta + 2 colas served on a wooden cutting board costs 510,000 dong (a little over 25,000). It's even very tasty. Pasta is just okay. The meat is really no joke though... It's a bit Instagrammable and it's hard to find the way, so it feels a bit like a hot spot in Euljiro, Korea haha. Since the address doesn't show up on Grab, set the destination to the nearby Tea Story House and go into the alley, and you'll be there right away. Eat high-quality steak at an affordable price!
This is definitely the best restaurant in Da Nang...City High. The entrance to the alley is difficult.

It was a little difficult to get to, but it was really, really delicious! The price is cheap and the staff are friendly. It wasn't exactly cool, but it was a delicious meal at just the right temperature. It's not that it's good value for money, but it's really delicious and the price is cheap. 5 menu items for 4 people were about 40,000 won or 5,000 won including tip. The road to get there may be a little scary, but it's really delicious and the atmosphere inside is great. It's not well known, but I hope it becomes widely known, so I'm leaving a review🥀

The salad was a bit bland.

The pork chop was really tasty for the price.
Good restaurant

The prices are so reasonable because Koreans don't go there. Rather than going to Babylon Steakhouse and paying a lot of money and getting ripped off, here you can get a great steak for 8,500 won. It's a hidden gem that everyone just passes by after seeing the exterior. If anyone reading this review visits, they'll probably thank me in their heart. ㅎㅎ And to the shop owner, do you remember me? The Korean guy who gave you a tip for promotion. I hope your restaurant will be an attraction in Danang. I will be back in Aug. Then, I want to see your big smile :) Farewell my friend
Love this place. Great food and even better service. The tacos are incredible.
This is one of the best and most delicious places to eat here in Vietnam. The place is small, but service and quality are HUGE!
A great place for a western style breakfast. The coconut coffee is amazing!

The food is good quality and it taste amazing. It's a bit difficult to find. You have to go into the small alley there and turn right and walk a bit further untill you see a small room with green walls. In there are a couple tables only. Again very good food. Enjoy
Foods are So great, Comfortable and good prices too
Very good dishes, cozy place but hard to find the location. No parking.
This is a very sumptuous Korean meal!!

The side dishes at the restaurant next to Han Market are limited, but average. The meat is cheap compared to Korean prices. The taste of the meat is so-so, but the texture is chewy. Two stars because of the texture. The service is friendly.
The pork neck assortment is absolutely delicious, even without the meat. When you eat it with grilled kimchi, you don't have to envy Korea.
It's delicious!~

I’ve visited this restaurant many times, and it never fails to impress me. The ambiance is peaceful, with music that perfectly complements the design and overall atmosphere.

The food is consistently excellent - beautifully plated, perfectly seasoned, and thoughtfully composed with ingredients that harmonize wonderfully. I also appreciate that the menu is changed/rotated regularly, so there’s always something different to discover.

What stands out the most is their authentic spirit of vegetarianism. Rather than trying to imitate or replicate the taste of meat, they focus on letting the natural flavors of the ingredients shine. Each dish feels genuine, creative, and delicious in its own right.

A place I always look forward to returning to.

The food here is excellent and the prices are very reasonable. The ambience is also too good - cozy and welcoming. We tried the lemongrass mushroom rice bowl, button mushrooms cooked with butter, garlic & herbs and a refreshing pomelo juice - all tasted really good.
The only small drawback for me was the thick gravy that came with the butter garlic herb mushrooms - it was on the sweeter side and I personally don’t prefer sweet dishes for lunch/dinner, so I couldn’t finish it all. Otherwise, everything was perfect and I’d definitely recommend this place for both food and atmosphere.

Sangha has quickly become our favorite vegetarian restaurant in town, offering not only delicious food but also a truly peaceful dining experience.

From the moment we stepped inside, we were welcomed by an atmosphere of serenity. Gentle Buddha music played softly in the background, and the subtle fragrance of pandan leaves filled the space, creating a calming and homelike feeling. It’s the kind of place where you immediately feel at ease, as though you’ve stepped away from the hustle and bustle of daily life.

One of the unique aspects of Sangha is that the menu changes every day. While this means you may not be able to enjoy the exact same dish on your next visit, it also keeps the dining experience exciting and full of pleasant surprises. We personally love this concept, as it gives us the chance to explore new flavors each time. Every dish we tried was both wholesome and flavorful — a perfect balance of being healthy yet deeply satisfying.

For groups, Sangha also offers set menus designed for two to six people, which makes it a wonderful choice for family meals or gatherings with friends. Each set feels thoughtfully prepared, showcasing a variety of dishes that highlight the richness of vegetarian cuisine.

Overall, Sangha is more than just a restaurant — it’s a place to enjoy nourishing food in a tranquil setting that feels almost spiritual. We left feeling not only full but also refreshed, and we look forward to returning again soon.

Tucked away on the quiet Hoàng Văn Thụ street, Sangha Vegetarian Restaurant offers a peaceful escape into the world of plant-based Vietnamese cuisine. This cozy and inviting spot is more than just a place to eat—it feels like a sanctuary, perfect for mindful dining.

From the moment you step in, the ambiance is serene and welcoming, with calming décor that reflects Buddhist influences. The staff are kind, soft-spoken, and attentive, adding to the overall tranquil atmosphere.

The menu is thoughtfully curated, featuring a wide variety of vegetarian and vegan dishes made from fresh, locally-sourced ingredients. Standout items include their lotus root salad, crispy mushroom rolls, and a rich, flavorful vegetarian hotpot that’s perfect for sharing. The brown rice with stir-fried vegetables and tofu is both wholesome and satisfying, while their herbal teas and smoothies provide a refreshing complement to the meal.

What sets Sangha apart is its commitment to health, balance, and spiritual nourishment—every dish feels intentional and lovingly prepared. Prices are affordable, making it accessible to locals and travelers alike.

Whether you’re vegetarian, vegan, or simply looking for a nourishing break from meat-heavy meals, Sangha is a must-visit gem in Đà Nẵng that delivers on taste, value, and heart.

Top-notch vegetarian restaurant in Hai Chau, Da Nang. It pairs so well an aesthetic and charm appealing to the tourist, with the surefire quality at a justifiable price that allthemore draws the local crowd. Food and beverages are served with beauty in simplicity, and an undeniable treat to the tastebuds. Service is perfectly amiable and attentive even on its busier lunch hours. The space itself is a woody, multi-storied affair so tastefully designed and amply tabled, accentuating the excellent dining experience one can expect to have here. I'd have another meal here when in Da Nang any day.

One of the best places I’ve eaten at in Da Nang!
The menu changes every week, and it’s a bit hard to figure out each dish, so I recommend ordering a few or going for one of the set menus.

The food is interesting, surprising, and delicious.
Service is excellent, the place is beautiful, and prices are great. The drinks were a bit too sweet, but that’s a minor detail.
We came here last year and really enjoyed it — came back again and the quality is still just as high. Highly recommend the dish with the passion fruit sauce and the Hoi An cao lau.

Food, drink was so delicious. Service was good, fast, polite and gentle. Views, decorations and atmosphere are beautiful and calm. I strongly recommend this amazing vegetarian to everyone. It’s a must try.
So amazing vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang. I really really love ❤️ it. soon delicious food and beautiful decorations. I am feeling how compassion vibe around overhere. Thank you so much for service

We went because the place was recommended from a friend. To be honest, we were not impressed with it. The food was alright, just wasn’t also as good as you would like to go back.

Pros:
- Beautiful garden
- Helpful waitress
- The food came fast

Cons:
- The menu was confusing / some parts were in Vietnamese and it wasn’t very clear what the meals are
- I ordered a drink and asked to be without sugar. When it came it was super sweet. I asked, and the waitress said it was with syrup. I asked if I can get one without it, and she said I can’t since it’s already pre made with the syrup.

Maybe I had higher expectations. Anyway, others might like it more.

Sangha is a fully vegan restaurant that I absolutely adore. The ambiance here is cozy and welcoming, enhanced by soothing music and the gentle sound of flowing water, creating a relaxing and pleasant atmosphere.

The menu at Sangha is both diverse and flexible. They offer set menus ideal for groups of two or more, making it convenient for family or friend gatherings. Additionally, there is a wide variety of à la carte options to choose from. The food is not only delicious but also beautifully presented, showcasing great attention to detail and care. What stands out the most is that the dishes are low in oil and incredibly healthy, yet they remain flavorful and leave a lasting impression.

Having visited Sangha many times, I am always satisfied and feel at ease enjoying their exceptional vegan cuisine in such a wonderful setting. This is definitely a place I’ll keep returning to and recommending to my friends.

Large place
Food was great
Vibe chilling
Many Trees are around you
Hmm i wasn’t satisfied with the staff here
A bit expensive but this place in good location so, can understand

My vegetarian boyfriend was extremely happy and said it was one of the best foods he had))) we tried King oyster mushroom from the “must try” section, the pho and also tofu with oyster mushroom - all was amazing, the sauces are fantastic. Also super nice ambience at the place.
Vegetarians stand up! Salute 🫡 , Everything I ordered was thoughtfully prepared and balanced in taste.  Each dish was beautifully presented and full of flavor. Highly recommended

Nestled amidst the bustling Da Nang streets, this exquisite vegetarian Vietnamese restaurant is a true haven for culinary enthusiasts. The captivating beauty of the interior and exterior captivates the senses, providing a visual feast that complements the delightful dining experience. While the prices may trend slightly higher than average, the exceptional taste and quality of the dishes confirm that every penny spent is indeed worthwhile, offering unbeatable value for money. I cannot recommend this place highly enough for those longing for a unique and satisfying dining experience.

Stepping into this culinary oasis felt like entering a hidden gem, surrounded by lush gardens and tranquil ponds that set the perfect stage for a serene meal. The soothing melodies in the background added to the ambiance, creating a peaceful retreat from the outside world. The attentive and caring staff further elevated the experience, ensuring that my culinary journey remained free from coriander, a thoughtful touch that truly impressed me.

The menu at this establishment leans towards healthier vegetarian choices, each dish a delightful blend of flavors that cater to both the palate and the body. The mango mushroom dish I indulged in was a revelation, combining sweet and savory notes in perfect harmony. Additionally, the lemon basil drink was a refreshing twist, especially for a basil enthusiast like myself, enhancing the overall dining experience.

During my visit, I was delighted to find a predominantly local crowd, a testament to the authenticity and quality of the cuisine offered here. The serene decor and background music further enhanced the relaxed atmosphere, creating a dining experience that was truly memorable. The creatively cooked dishes, such as the eggplant creation, showcased the culinary prowess of the kitchen, while the flavorful ginger tea with generous ginger slices added an extra touch of warmth to the meal.

For a dining experience that marries beauty, flavor, and tranquility, this vegetarian Vietnamese restaurant in Da Nang is an absolute must-visit, especially for those seeking a culinary adventure that delights all the senses.

Alex from Perth

We had dinner here and found the vegetarian food very delicious. The decor is very relaxing as was the background music. Service was polite and dishes like eggplant were creatively cooked. The ginger tea drink was flavourful and full of ginger slices. Their garden at the entrance is also very nice.

Upscale vegetarian – only by design. Menu exclusively in Vietnamese but staff are willing to present a photos to help the ordering process.

Food was acceptable, price is definitely in the high range for such an establishment. I didn’t feel like dinner was entirely upscale or fine dining but a fairly good attempt.

Do I feel like the food is healthier because it doesn’t contain meat? Not really but this is an important niche in Vietnam especially as the denizens of this place go vegetarian once a month based on the lunar calendar.

Would I come back? Probably in a group as I am required to go meatless.

Is there an opportunity to create a truly upscale vegetarian experience in this count y or anywhere else? Most certainly.

I have been there a few times now - enough times to say with some degree of certainty that it is an excellent vegetarian restaurant. The food is always beautifully cooked and presented with such refined yet flavoursome artistry. It may be a tad too pricey for regular visits, but for what you get in terms of quality, décor, ambiance, and service, it is quite worth it especially for a nice occasion. They have set menus which are quite good for sharing. The menu seems to change frequently, and each new dish as good as the previous one. Even my non-vegetarian friends and family members have been surprised by how delicious the food is.

Very thankful for the kind assistance of the staff, who was patient enough to answer my query of the difference in the Buddhist vegetarian diet in Vietnam. According to her, the southern Buddhist diet takes alliums.

They were able to prepare allium free for a good amount of dishes which set my tastebuds on a fireworks experience hahahaa. We ate so much think we impressed the staff. Hahaha. I was so happy to be able to catch up with my fibre intake this meal. Beautifully presented and tastefully prepared, including the drinks. Their staff speak some English but things were made simpler with translation app.

Came to this beautiful restaurant for lunch on a Friday afternoon. We're all vegan so it's always great to be able to go to all all vegetarian restaurant.
While they have an extensive menu, we found it challenging to find enough entrees to accommodate a mushroom allergy. Several of the options would have worked however we were told that they weren't available today 😮‍💨
We ended up ordering two dishes...both of which were delicious, although not our original options.

Please visit this restaurant if you are vegetarian or you like the authentic vegetarian foods. Chilled vibe, great foods, you will see many monks here to enjoy their dinner. The moment when I stepped into the restaurant I feel calm and peaceful

Their foods come with set menu and the quality of foods are decent. Though is a little bit pricey but it’s totally worth it

What an amazing place to have one of the best vegetarian meals. We found it through Google maps and decided to have dinner there just by looking at the reviews and the menu. However we were overly impressed with the whole decor and service of the staff. It definitely turned out to be one of the highlights of our time in Da Nang. Loved the food, the atmosphere, the decor. Would love to visit again!

An outstanding vegetarian restaurant! The food was full of flavor, fresh, and beautifully presented. The setting is sublime, offering a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere that makes the experience even more enjoyable. On top of that, the service was truly attentive, smiling and professional.

The best dining experience we had in Da Nang. We were a group of three and ordered one of the set menus which was plenty of food for us. Everything was well prepared, visually beautiful and tasted amazing.
I wish we could have gone back another time before we left.
The service and atmosphere is truly wonderful as well.

This was my our first meal straight from the airport and our most memorable one in Da Nang.

The food was amazing and the decor was top notch.  The atmosphere was lively, which made for a great backdrop to our amazing meal.

We had Menu 2 and everything was innovative, super delicious, and with a great vfm.
It's one of those places you eager to eat more of their food.

Silken tofu with passion fruit, avocado and mushrooms was out of this world.

Decor was beautiful. Food was delicious (the pho sauce omg!! And crispy wontons). But they took 40 min to give us food 😭 and there were fishes in the pond that felt a bit sus for a vegetarian/vegan place. Sugarcane coconut drink was so good - way better than the mango tea I got.

Really beautiful vegetarian vietnamese restaurant. The interior and exterior of the restaurant is amazing. The food is a little more expensive than usual, but it tastes great! So good value for money. Highly recommended.

I never leave reviews, but feel compelled to because this place was so good. The food was perfect and very fresh. The seagrapes, something so simple and stupid, were immaculately clean and delicious. Even the dumb dipping sauce for the spring rolls was great: perfect vinegary balance of sour, sweet, and bitterness. The soup was just a soup but very enjoyable nonetheless, ingredients full of life, neither stale nor old. The best part was the drinks. They were so good I ended up ordering three. Pictured here are 1 orange / carrot / ginger, 2 black tea mix orange, and 3 mango mix with shirmp salt and chili powder. I would definitely go back. [The food pictured here I circled in red on the menu.]
I’m Vietnamese and I must say this is the best vegetarian restaurant so far. Foods are delicious, decorations and environment are so relax and nice. Staffs after polite and professional too.

Tucked away in an unassuming corner, this restaurant is a delightful surprise. Whether you're vegetarian or not, the menu offers something truly special—flavorful dishes that impress with every bite.

The staff make you feel welcome the moment you step in. Absolutely Instagram-worthy, with charming decor that invites you to relax and savor the experience.

Don’t just pass by—this spot is worth a detour.

That was the best vegetarian food in my life, full of flavour, fresh…. Wonderful
Highly recommended, i wish have that restaurant in Europe
Fantastic atmosphere, service, decor, music
This place should be The Michelin Bib !
Love that place

We have been here twice and the food never failed to amaze us. The restaurant has taken vegetarian food to the next level with great presentation and super interesting recipe. A bonus point is the super peaceful ambience.

What a lovely oasis to enjoy a delicious meal in.
The garden and ponds compliment one's dinning as was the music
Staff attentive and caring ensuring my choices remained corriander free
Meals are more healthy choice vegetarian but soooo yum
Esp the mango mushroom I opted for see image
The lemon basil drink amazing esp for a basil fan like me
Wish I'd discovered earlier in my stay
Beautiful food with a nice relaxed atmosphere. Mostly local people here which is always a good sign. A must visit if you are vegetarian and in Da Nang.

The place is charming, with fish ponds, plants and rocks. The food is vegetarian (not vegan) so ask in advance if they use eggs or fish sauce.
They have some set menu that I recommend; and the sugar cane / coconut drink that is sweet and tasty 😋
Fantastic vegetarian place with some of the nicest and calming scenery of any place in da nang.  Many gluten free options.

Chỗ này ăn rất rất rất là ngon nhe! Phải nói Vietnam mình có nhiều nhà hàng chay ngon quá! Thật là tuyệt vời!

Vietnam has some really amazing vegetarian restaurants that I wish we had more in America! I can eat all vegetarian here and I’ll be okay because they’re so delicious!

This place has only been opened the last 2 years. From the moment we got out of our grab car, I instantly fell in love with the entrance of the restaurant. It’s serene, peaceful and makes you feel so calm!

Highly recommend if you’re visiting Đà Nẵng!

Very delicious vegetarian food! And beautiful restaurant outside and inside with lots of details, plants, candles. Friendly staff, menu unfortunately only in Vietnamese; staff showed us pictures, so we chose. Highly recommended: Aubergine, mushroom noodles, coconut drink; ate there 2 days in a row 😋 …
This is the best restaurant in Da Nang. I’m not even vegetarian. They have a new menu every week. Food is always delicious. Staff speaks perfect English and super kind.

Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner in Sangha. Truly a gem. Only setback was the restaurant was a little busy then and the drinks service was delayed. We were half way thru dinner but have not been served drinks we had ordered.
Overall, it was a nice dining experience and the environment is beautiful.

Very good vegetarian restaurant-we ordered 4 dishes and dessert and paid 25€ in total- it was very good!!! Atmosphere and plaiting felt like fine dining. Even though there was no English menu, the waitress showed us pictures and explained the dishes very well. We highly recommend it!

The best food we have eaten in Vietnam. Absolutely delicious. 10/10

At first was a little sad to see no alcohol on the menu. But you don’t need it with the quality the food brings. Go for a drink after instead!
Wow!

A lovely oasis away from charming but tiring chaos of Vietnam. Delicious vegan dishes and teas. Beautiful and relaxing aesthetics. A must do in DaNang. Recommend the kale dumplings and the corn soup. Set menus avaliable for groups 3+.

This is hands down one of the best vegetarian restaurants in Vietnam. They have a small menu, but everything was done exceptionally well. The tastes were so complex and deliciously put together. The drinks were crafted like a professional mixologist was making them! The decor was warm and inviting and had relaxing, calm buddhist music. The only drawback for foreign customers is that there was no english menu available, however the staff were ready to help us choose something as they spoke perfect english. I highly recommend coming here! The price is very ready for the quality of food.

This is definitely a go to place when you want vegetarian food. Not just the food is so decent but the atmosphere in Sangha is also really calm and peaceful. It’s really suitable for recharging our battery after a busy day in such a hustle and bustle city.

Not a fan or vegetarian. But I really liked the atmosphere and the food here. The restaurant made me feel so calm and we enjoyed the food without knowing it’s vegetarian. Love this place and will definitely come back.
Beautiful place and wonderful food. We specially enjoyed the butter mushroom. The mango smoothie was delicious!

Perfect ambience for a special night out. Restaurant does not offer lots of options in the menu but whatever that's offered is quite decent. Try the hot pot. The soup is yummy. The wontons are "meaty" and the sweet and sour sauce goes well with them.
Nice charming place with many flowers and trees. The food and service is good. They only have a Vietnamese menue card but staff showed us pictures of the food for easy selection.

Lovely environment.
Service is good! Waitress advised me not to over order.
Food taste good but not a lot of selection.

The place is beautiful with  a lot of charm.
You may want to sit outside if your are looking for a quiet environment because the inside is pretty noisy.

They don't have any English menu and the staff doesn't really speak English. So it will be a blind date with your dishes.
The staff is nice but when you have been served they just ghost you which makes it a bad service finally. Even when you want to pay it becomes difficult to catch someone.

The food is OK. But nothing extraordinary. For the same price or even cheaper I had better.

Average cost per person will be 150K.

It was an experience that I won't renew.
The restaurant is very pleasantly decorated with a Buddhist theme. Service is excellent. Some staff are able to speak English. Food and drinks are reasonably priced. This place is usually full.

Sangha is a vegetarian restaurant beautifully decorated with a zen-like atmosphere, making it a relaxing and inviting place to dine. I admire the fact that Sangha also uses the profits from the restaurant to support many meaningful community activities.

The menu features a variety of traditional Vietnamese vegetarian dishes, as well as some more innovative creations. There are not many choices to choose from, but the dishes are changed regularly to keep things fresh. The prices are reasonable, with my portion of Phở Chiên costing VND 105.000. However, it was a large portion of food, so I felt that it was worth the price.

The staff is attentive and always nearby to check if you need something. The restaurant also has an outdoor seating area, which is perfect for enjoying a meal on a warm day. I will definitely be back to try their refreshing beverages next time I visit.
The food was absolutely amazing! Not a vegetarian, but the food was so tasty. Extremely flavorful and the drinks were very good

Amazing vegetarian Vietnamese food in Da Nang! The restaurant is so beautiful with amazing decor, the food is so fresh and delicious and reasonably price. We ordered a set menu for 4 people which came with summer rolls, salads, curry, bread, rice etc. for 475k in total. The drinks were really unique and yummy too!

A lovely place with a lovely atmosphere and nice staff.
The food was so good, especially their best seller, which is kind of a garlic soup with mushrooms.

It was a relief to find a good vegetarian restaurant with a great ambiance. I liked their ice tea, rolls and corn soup. The rest of the items I ordered were not that good or didnt please my taste buds.

Calm and relaxing garden, good to get out of the noisy streets for an hour or two. We had Peach Tea with Lemongras and Mango, amazing! Also yummi Spring rolls.
I recommend 100% :)
Absolutely fabulous vegetarian restaurant. From environment, service, and delightful food combinations - top tier. Highly recommend the prepared sets. Yum.
The best vegetarian restaurant in Danang City
The most delicious meal we've had so far in all of our trip throughout Vietnam. Fresh, delicious. So beautifully presented. And all vegetarian!!!
One of the most delicious vegetarian food that I have been trying in Vietnam! You must to try for yourself, stuff very kind and helpful.

The food was delicious, a little on the expensive side but not unreasonable. A bit noisy with clattering dishes and cutlery. I had to ask for a napkin and the drink I ordered - it came after I was finished my meal. Staff seemed very apathetic.
It's a very good vegetarian restaurant in city center. All dishes are well-decorated and taste yummy.
A great place for vegans! Love the interior decor.  The only reason I couldn’t give it a 5 is because we have been several times now but the quality is slightly inconsistent 😅
Delicious vegetarian food, nice and clean restaurant with great service. Can’t remember how much I spent but it was reasonable and very filling.
Amazing tranquil location with incredible vegetarian/vegan food - everything was so fresh and flavorful.  Great for big parties.  Super clean as well.

This is the first time we visit this vegan restaurant in Danang. We loved the atmosphere there. Staff were very friendly and even took initiatives to take picture for us. Also, I would like to compliment the girl serve us who is showing her patience on explaining the foods on the menu to us with fluent English! This was adding marks! For sure we will come back this restaurant again if we visit Danang.

Just great - the staff was very friendly and helpful: as there is no English menu available they showed us photos and explained the options
Quality and taste was great
Presentation amazing

This place is just amazing at every corner and food and service and atmosphere.
Visit and enjoy. Give yourself a break from the hustle out there.
Delicious food and great decoration
Love love love Sangha! The food is exquisite and the surroundings are very peaceful. The staff are delightful. It’s a definite weekly dinner visit for me!

Sangha Vegetarian Restaurant has quickly become one of my favorite spots for plant-based dining. The moment I stepped in, I was greeted by a calming, Zen-like atmosphere that perfectly complements their philosophy of mindful eating. The food here is not only delicious but also artfully prepared, showcasing the beauty and versatility of vegetarian cuisine.

The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, from hearty soups to flavorful stir-fries, all made with fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Every dish I’ve tried has been bursting with flavor, yet feels light and nourishing. One of my personal favorites is their signature pho, which has a rich, savory broth without any of the heaviness of traditional versions.

What I appreciate most about Sangha is their commitment to health-conscious eating. You can really tell that each meal is crafted with care and intention, making it a place where you can indulge without any guilt. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to offer recommendations based on your preferences.

Overall, Sangha is a must-visit for anyone looking for a peaceful dining experience with exceptional vegetarian food. Whether you’re a long-time vegetarian or just curious, this restaurant will impress!

Very nice location and helpful staff. Tasty food and various menu changing weekly. Been there with family many times and nevery disappointed.  I really enjoy the buffet they sometimes arrange. Strongly suggested if you want some variation for your vegetarian food.
Delicous food n decoration really nice, my fav place for vegeterian food in danang city. U should try
Great food very knowledgeable waiting staff and very creative vegetarian stuff
Beautifully decorated restaurant, calm and quiet atmosphere, delicious food. We loved it and would visit again.
I‘m not vegan but this place is really high end and nice great authentic food could have bigger portions tho but very very good
Vegetarian food, beautifully presented with a lot of love, a bit too raw for my taste, but in a very pure buddhist way.

The food here is delicious! One of the best places we've eaten vegetarian or not. You can tell how fresh the ingredients are and the restaurant is beautifully decorated. Prices are higher than normal but it was definitely worth it!
Beautiful and great food!! Would be great if you have menu in English or picture menu.
The food is so fresh and delicious! Nice space!
I will convert to vegetarian if every vegetarian foods taste like these.
Very nice environment and food

Great venue and great food!! Worth visiting;)

Altho it's better if you understand Vietnamise or exactly know what you want. That make it way easier. Service was..not as gerat as the food tho!

Loved food as well as this hidden gem atmoshphere! Thank you..
Good food and service if the servants learn english would be icing on the cake
Low key high class place to eat. The ambience and food was really good.
Fantastic. One of the best restaurants in Danang. Service, food and environment superb.
This is the first time we been here and we really love it!!! The service was nice and food was really stunning

Avoid Sangha Vegetarian Restaurant in Da Nang at All Costs

If I could give zero stars, I would. Sangha Vegetarian Restaurant markets itself as a high-end establishment, but the experience was nothing short of infuriating.

Here’s why:

1. Deceptive and Inaccurate Menu
They claim to have six rotating menus, but none of them are accurate. I asked about multiple items, and every time I was told they didn’t have what I wanted. When I inquired about protein options, I was first told there was none, then miraculously, a dish with tofu appeared. But guess what? The menu clearly stated it didn’t have tofu. Their excuse? “Translation mistake.” No, it’s not. It’s just a poorly managed menu.
Then, I saw another dish labeled as having spring rolls. They showed me a picture, and there were no spring rolls. Again, “translation mistake.” This is beyond ridiculous—how can customers make informed decisions when the menu is flat-out wrong?

2. Rude and Incompetent Staff
The staff were dismissive and treated me like an idiot for questioning the obvious contradictions in their menu. They walked off mid-conversation, leaving me to figure out the mess on my own. This level of service is unacceptable anywhere.

3. Ridiculously Overpriced
They charge many times more than other restaurants in Da Nang while offering subpar service and a chaotic dining experience. They’re pretending to be a premium establishment but fail to deliver on even the basics.

4. No Accountability
It’s clear the management doesn’t care. If they did, they’d have a proper menu, train their staff to be respectful, and ensure the customer experience matches the premium prices they charge.

Sangha is the worst restaurant I’ve ever been to. The owner should shut it down, fire everyone, and start fresh with a restaurant that has a functioning menu and a competent team. Save your money and eat literally anywhere else in Da Nang. This place is a total joke.

Of all my good food experiences across Asia, I hv eaten in Japan, Hong Kong, Korea, Taiwan , Singapore, Malaysia, Cambodia, Laos… THIS TOPS THE LIST ! The food was so so good ! I will just plan to come to Da nang for this … it’s hands down …
It is a very beautiful restaurant. They have some vegan dishes. Can recommend 🫶✨ …
Fantastic vegetarian restaurant with great atmosphere. Drinks and food where very fresh and tasty. Would totally recommend to everyone who likes fine vegetarian cuisine
Delicious food and a beautiful setting! Wonderful meal!
Best vegetarian food i ever had. Decorations are impressive. Staff are super nice. Will come back again when im around this area

I really wanted to love this vegetarian spot with its soothing vibes & creative dishes.  Overall I have to give them high marks on ambition - not only do they have some really creative & unusual pairings (silken tofu with an …

One of the best restaurant for Vietnamese cuisine
Staff is so friendly
Delicious food and peaceful atmosphere. Highly recommend!
Lovely atmosphere, really tasty and affordable food. Great place for vegans and vegetarian (and for everyone else) in Danang.

This is the most beautiful restaurant in town that serves the best Asian vegetarian menu. Our healing journey starts with an Instagramable Zen garden at the entrance to an absolutely cozy atmosphere with decorations of Zen buddhism. Not …
There is cosy and naturally space for Vegetarian. all foods were nice.

One of the more expensive vegetarian restaurants I've eaten in in Vietnam, but the price is reflective of the excellent quality ingredients, rich in herbs and spices. We ordered two mains per person as the portions were on the small side. Relaxing atmosphere. The juices were exceptional.

The food was very fast and delicious and LOADED with sugar which was yummy but also concerning, haha :)

The service was great, though the vibe was not what I expected.

We were looking for a quiet and intimate meal and the restaurant was very noisy.

Even the mantra music was played very loudly.

Perhaps I would come back for lunch, but not again for dinner. Way too noisy for my taste.

Portions were medium size, the value is okay but not great.

The ambiance of this restaurant is gorgeous. The menu is completely in Vietnamese which made me feel good as a foreigner because it felt authentic. The server showed us pictures on her phone of the dishes so we could pick from there.

The items that we chose were items I have not seen for vegan Vietnamese food at other places. The young tofu in the platter we ordered was divine. It was our last night in Da Nang or we would have gone back for dinner the next day. Absolutely fantastic.

Walked into this place by coincidence and got totally mesmerized by the food, service and ambience. It was just perfect. Made this video as a gratitude to those who made this wonderful place. A MUST VISIT to all vegans visiting Da Nang.

Their staff tell us that most of their food with alliums, onion garlic, unable to remove as sauce are pre made.

Anyway this restaurant is truly beautiful and the staff are friendly.
The food is nice. The environment is calm and peaceful.
I have eaten here twice and both times the service was excellent and the food even better!  I highly recommend!!
Excellent restaurant with delicious vegetarian food which is fresh tasting. The nấm sốt bơ tỏi is phenomenal. The atmosphere is relaxed and peaceful. Highly recommend!
Everything's delicious!!

As close to perfect as it gets!! This place is nothing short of amazing! Delicious food, plenty of vegan options, attentive staff,  professional service, generous proportions, great prices, wonderful ambience, and more! We absolutely loved it!
Utterly delicious, beautifully presented, and unexpected. Probably our best dining experience in all of Vietnam!
Vegan restaurant, the soup contains pineapple which is super delicious!

Restaraunt looks amazing, it was quite complicate to order because they didn’t have an english menu. My friend asked them via Google translate if the ordered food is without milk because he is vegan, but the smoothie contained milk. This could be an amazing place but they need to improve for that! Also weird order of giving out the food. I received my drink when I already finished my starter. My main dish received minutes before my friends dish - fun fact we had been the only table at that time. Lack of service.
Great food in a very nice restaurant.

I tried to go last night and was denied entry. I was met at the door with a lady stating the kitchen had closed, even though as I was leaving a stream of new customers where arriving and entering with nor problems. The lady told me the times they were open the next day so i decided to give them another try. So the next day I turned up and again was denied entry for the lunchtime service (even though I came at the times I was previously told the night before). If you are black, just forget it. I previously came here with 2 white friends and had no problems, then when I tried to come back by myself on 2 occasions, I was denied entry?? It doesn't make sense and made me feel quite sad and embarrased. I won't be returning and won't be recommending it to anyone else. There are better more accomdating places in Danang where everyone is treated equally.
We had a fantastic experience and the food was exceptional. Every course we had delicious and so creative.

great vegetarian place. stellar ambiance and great staff who were attentive and helped serve me. they didn't have an english menu but one of the staff had pictures of the food. the matcha jelly drink was one of the best things i've ever tasted. would definitely return.

I was lucky enough to be taken here for  my birthday lunch what a great decision. All the dishes we had were delicious everything was so fresh. Lovely ambiance the restaurant was very busy but it was not noisy so you could have quiet conversations. Highly recommend this restaurant

This restaurant has a wonderful food instead for 5 stars I have to give them 1 star for the service: no English menu so waiter need to explan by their app, no paper napkin ( only wetnapkin with chemical and non degradable) bad for the environment, I asked for but manager refuse to provide customer needed. considering this is a healthy food for the environment, there for the owner should considering provide this services ( provide paper napkin for free of charge not for a paid unenviromental wetnapkin,) considered for high-class establishment .

Nice, lovely ambience vegetarian restaurant. Not recommended for those who can't eat onion and garlic. I pleaded the waitress to ask the chef to cook somethings for us without onion and garlic but they refuse. So we left without eating anything.
Loved the vibe of the place. Ordered a curry, fried spring rolls (could have been less oily) and mango coconut salad. Mango smoothie was delicious!! A big thumbs up from me.
Peaceful place, nice restaurant, good service staff and delicious food.
Their staff mentioned that all their food contain onion and garlic which can't be removed. What a pity that we did not manage to try any of the food.
Fresh and nutrition food with great decoration.
10/10 found this restaurant accidentally and WAO it is the best vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang. It is definitely crazy amazing. Definitely a MUST try when you are in Da Nang.
Excellent food! I’m vegetarian but my boyfriend is a meat eater and he found the food to be top notch as well, including their version of his favorite Vietnamese dish.

Great vegetarian restaurant. No English menu but very kind and attentive staff talked us through everything and made great suggestions.
Thank you for making our Da Nang trip more delicious 😋
Delicious Vegetarian Food. Beautiful ambience. Quite busy - may need advance booking. Portions a bit small. Unique combinations.
Wow! Beautiful atmosphere, helpful staff and delicious vegan food! No English menu but the waitress showed us pictures and talked through the menu. Would highly recommend :)
It's a beautiful restaurant with Buddhist decor and I really wanted to stay. Unfortunately the extremely strong smell of essential oil made me feel nauseous and I had to leave.
Tranquil place with great food.
Delicious vegetarian food! Highly recommend
Such a nice place with vegetarian food. We love it there!

They put on an extra "tax" by forcing cost for the napkins that they give you. No information that they will charge you for it.
Food is good though.
It was delicious 🤤
Good foods, the owner has good taste. If you go in a group more than 4 people, you should book a table in advance.
A little bit expensive but it’s a VERY good vegetarian restaurant in Da Nang. The place is lovely and the meal delicious ! I recommend !
The best eating experience during our stay in Vietnam. Delicious food, nice atmosphere.
Very delicious food, respectful people, the ambiance is awesome
not foreigner friendly because no english menu… they give you a napkin at the beginning of the meal but it’s not free and they do not tell you you have to pay for it and food was ok
If you're a vegetarian then you're gonna wanna come here, if you're not a vegetarian then you're gonna wanna come here. Very very good.
Absolutely delicious food. Dined in for lunch. Also, mint and lime juice, just wonderful. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Such a amazing vegetarian restaurant. Food is delicious & the staff is very nice.

Nice vegetarian restaurant. Definitely will visit again!

Great !!

Amazing food, vibe. Must try - wonton.

Brought me a wet towel which I didn’t ask for and then charged me for it. Food was mediocre.
Foods & drinks are very nice and healthy! Very worth to come!
Very fair priced nice food
Clean, very good service, all lovely staff.
Calm and tranquil place with delicious vegetarian options to choose from
Did not expect it to be so good. Food was really tasty

Fantastic little restaurant in a quiet nature filled garden.
Spectacular vegan food.

Love everything about this place. Highly recommended 🌱

My 2nd time to visit the restaurant

good
Vegetarian dishes
High recommend!
Hands down the best vegetarian place I know - wow!!

I came here on a rainy day, the restaurant space is cozy and peaceful. I sat on the 2nd floor in an air-conditioned room so it was quite quiet. The music helped me relax and calm down. The food portion was not too big, just enough for 1-2 people, the decor was beautiful and luxurious. The flavor here is the highlight, I thought vegetarian food would be bland and retain its natural flavor, but the dishes I tried were quite rich and flavorful, especially the vermicelli salad was very delicious, thank you everyone. Regarding the service, I found it normal, because I sat in the room, the staff did not take good care, when I needed something, I had to go out and call, it was a bit annoying. My experience was quite good, I will come back next time.

Vegetarian restaurant in the center of Da Nang, always crowded on the 1st and 15th of the lunar month.
The restaurant space is spacious, with many scenes. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and peaceful.
Professional staff, dishes come out quickly.
The food is okay, not too special compared to nearby restaurants like Thuy but beautifully presented.
The price is high, but suitable for the space and segment positioning. I went with 3 people, ate about 500k, just enough to be full.

🌱 I rate 5 stars for the vegetarian restaurant because of the delicious food, beautiful open space and lovely service. There is only one small point that I hope the restaurant will pay more attention to: parking. Both times I visited the restaurant, I was not assisted in parking my vehicle, instead I had to carry it across the street. If the security guards were friendlier and more supportive of customers, the experience at the restaurant would definitely be more complete and warm.

The restaurant service is very attentive, the staff is enthusiastic, the food and drinks are very delicious and flavorful, there is nothing to complain about, will support when I have the opportunity to return to Da Nang.

The pleasure begins as soon as you enter the lush garden, cooler and quieter than the street.
Excellent value for money and creative and delicious dishes. There were four of us, including two vegetarians, but the whole group loved the dishes. The restaurant's interior decor is soothing; it makes you feel at home. The only downside would be the service, which could be improved: explanations and smiles...

Today we visited a vegetarian cafe in the Hai Chau area, and I want to share my impressions. The space is very large, beautiful and clean. It is obvious that they value design: the interior is made in a wooden style, many interesting details - bottles, inscriptions. The atmosphere is simply wow, everything looks civilized, stylish and pleasant. Even when we came, monarchs were sitting there, which added to the feeling of coziness and significance of the place.

Now about the prices. They are, in our opinion, above average. Even as a foreigner, I know many places where you can eat no less deliciously, but for less money. For Vietnam, this is a really expensive option.

As for the dishes: the presentation is beautiful, the food is delicious, but I can’t say that it is something incredible, for which I would like to come back again. Many dishes turned out to be very spicy, and we were not warned about this. For me, a lover of Indian and Asian spicy cuisine, this is still normal, but for my husband, who does not eat spicy food at all, this was a big problem.

Overall, the impressions are good, but for us, this place is not the kind of place we want to come back to. If you decide to come, know that it is delicious, beautiful, but be prepared for spicy dishes and a high bill.

Absolute insider tip!

Dreamy setting, unusual dishes. Superbly high-quality, incredibly delicious, and lovingly prepared food.

There were no European tourists there either (so it's "still" a little insider tip 😊)

It's delicious for the mouth and delicious for the eyes. Who can stand it?

I would have rated 3 stars but thank you to the manager for handling the above situation very well.

The vegetarian restaurant serves enthusiastically, the food is strange and delicious, you will not be bored when eating vegetarian. I was on a full moon day and was served quickly so I liked this place.
A traditional Vietnamese restaurant. The atmosphere, music, and food are all excellent. A local friend took me to this vegetable restaurant. I highly recommend it.
Vegetarian restaurant with the most beautiful and elegant space in Da Nang. Delicious food, beautifully presented, sitting and eating with Buddhist music in the background creates a gentle feeling.

Each dish is beautifully presented, creating the feeling of enjoying a work of art. The menu is not fixed but changes regularly, bringing pleasant surprises to diners every time they visit. Peaceful, imbued with the spirit of meditation, very suitable for relaxing after stressful working hours. Although located right in the center of Da Nang, Sangha still maintains its tranquility, helping diners feel like they are temporarily away from the hustle and bustle of life outside.

On the occasion of the Full Moon Day, I went vegetarian, and got lost in a green - beautiful - peaceful garden in the heart of the city, with dishes that were meticulously cared for, beautiful, delicious and everything was cute down to every detail.
🥢 Sangha - Vegetarian Restaurant: 84 Hoang Van Thu, Hai Chau, Da Nang
I leave behind the photos I took for fun, without editing or filters, so that you can truly see some of Sanghai's naturally attractive features. Each vegetarian dish has a harmonious flavor, quite a strange combination, and the decor is very delicate. For drinks, I recommend combining healthy juices! The space is cool, there is a garden, a lake, lots of green trees, the house has air conditioning, every corner is beautiful. Even each pair of chopsticks is wrapped in pandan leaves, both beautiful and fragrant, this is the first time I've seen it ^^
The price is not as cheap as normal vegetarian restaurants, because this is a restaurant with careful investment and attentive service. You will pay well for the quality of food, space and spirit here. The restaurant has Set Menus available for 4 people, priced around 400k - 600k. Today I went to eat for 2 people, ordered a few dishes and drinks for 200k/person.
Any day you want a healing, natural, peaceful, peaceful vibe, just come here...
Delicious food, beautiful decoration, cozy and luxurious space

Explosions of flavors! The food is incredibly good, as are the cocktails! The location is magnificent! Very good vegetarian restaurant.
Just one small drawback: the staff is not very welcoming.
Very nice space, lots of trees, food is also very delicious

- Diverse and rich menu with many creative and unique vegetarian dishes, made from fresh ingredients, ensuring food hygiene and safety. The taste of the dishes is light and delicate, preserving the natural flavor of vegetables and fruits.
- Beautiful and meticulous presentation, creating an attraction for diners.
- Space: Spacious, airy, quiet with modern and luxurious design.
- There are many green trees creating a feeling of relaxation, close to nature.
- Staff: Attentive, enthusiastic and friendly service.
- Reasonable price compared to the quality of food and service, so it is a bit higher than the general level, but it is worth it!!!

Sangha Restaurant is a great choice for those who want to enjoy light and nutritious vegetarian cuisine in a luxurious and quiet space. But you should book a table in advance, especially on the full moon day or M1 because it is extremely crowded.
Delicious vegetarian restaurant, classy space

Oh my god, this is the best vegetarian restaurant I've ever been to. I'm satisfied with every dish, especially the pumpkin cheese soup. Spacious and beautiful space. Attentive service. Only the price is expensive. If it were cheaper, I would definitely come here again and again.

Have eaten here more than 10 times. But yesterday was the worst experience for me.
Ordered noodle soup hotpot with é leaves. Vermicelli noodles are not boiled in boiling water and have a slightly sour smell. My 3-year-old child ate vermicelli and had a bloated stomach. He ate it from noon but still couldn't digest it at night. His stomach hurt and he vomited all the vermicelli!!! Let's ask, why is vermicelli made from pureed rice flour? Why do you eat it for more than half a day and still not be able to digest it? Or what substance is the vermicelli impregnated with???
(The photo is from another time because I didn't take a photo yesterday)

Sangha - Vegetarian Restaurant 🍃

This is my favorite vegetarian restaurant, because the vibes of the restaurant are very pleasant. Although located in the center, when entering the restaurant, I feel comfortable and extremely quiet. The restaurant is beautiful, every corner feels chill, airy and spacious. Outdoor tables and indoor tables have their own space 💯

The food is very delicious, suitable for the taste, beautifully presented, the price is a bit high compared to other vegetarian restaurants. When you come here, you must try the Garlic Butter Mushrooms, super delicious, every time I come here I have to order, sitting and writing but still craving 🤤 The bread pate is also okay, just the right amount of sourness. The fried wontons with sweet and sour sauce must be, I like crispy rolls so it suits me. The tofu with passion fruit sauce is a bit sour and the dill noodles are eaten like La Vong fish cakes, this is normal. You must try the orange palm tea, it's delicious and refreshing, I crave it 😂 Coconut lime is cool, cooling Shangha is too sour, not suitable huhu

Overall, I really like Sangha, I keep coming back 🙆🏼‍♀️

💸 200,000/person
📍Sangha, 84 Hoang Van Thu, Da Nang
⏰10:30AM - 8PM

Luxurious, cozy space, lots of trees, suitable for those who love nature... I went with my whole family and they arranged very spacious seats, fast service. The staff are very enthusiastic and cute... will support Sangha long term

Very disappointed with the female manager here, she speaks without subject or predicate, I am also a tour guide but I really cannot accept this kind of service, when it comes to cleaning up the guests' things, she doesn't even ask permission to clean up or not, when the children walk back and forth, she tells them to move aside and not leave their things, I don't understand this kind of communication.

Being alone is not necessarily lonely, sometimes being alone is also to listen and love yourself. 🌿

Lovely restaurant in the heart of the city. My team came by when the restaurant was quite crowded but were very impressed with how quickly the order came out. The dishes are delicious and the prices are reasonable. Extremely recommend!

A true gem! Highly recommended. Excellent vegetarian cuisine with wonderful flavors and special ingredients. The ambiance and decor are magnificent; it's a true oasis! The silken tofu with avocado and passion fruit and the dish with eggplant and mushrooms are particularly recommended. The summer rolls with fresh seaweed were also very good. The house juices are also delicious. A great experience at a very good price!
Sangha is wonderful from the decoration to the incredibly delicious food. Sitting here makes you feel calm and relaxed.

The highlights for me were the chopsticks beautifully wrapped in banana leaves, the fish pond behind the window, and the beautiful garden.
Very delicious. Every dish is delicious. Beautiful space. The staff is attentive and enthusiastic. Highly recommend 👏🏼👏🏼

One of the top vegetarian restaurants in Da Nang, from the entrance you can smell the very pleasant scent of agarwood. The restaurant has a very eye-catching and Buddhist decor space. For a long time, we have been eating grilled food, hot pot, etc., so today our group changed the wind and went to eat vegetarian food. As soon as we stood in front of the gate, the sound of wind chimes, the space, the music, etc. made our group's mouths want to calm down, extremely peaceful. 

At first, we were afraid of getting bored, but the food was quite diverse, presented in European style and leaning towards organic, clean food. According to the staff, the menu is also changed weekly. The drinks are also extremely high quality, our group had to ask for more ice to make it less bland. If you don't eat, coming here to sit and drink water is also quite okay. 

The 5 of us ordered a set of quite full food, plus 5 glasses of water, the bill was 860k. This place operates non-profit so we cannot issue invoices.
The restaurant has a great view, the wood and brick space is very gentle and covered with cool green trees. The food is delicious and very diverse. The whole group enjoyed it very much

The vegetarian restaurant is beautifully decorated. The space is quiet, ideal for meditation and mindfulness. The lush greenery surrounding, combined with natural elements such as large stone vases and wooden accents, further enhance the tranquility and harmony. This is truly a wonderful space to practice mindfulness, the design is delicate and peaceful.

Best vegetarian restaurant in Danang 👍

I arrived at the restaurant at noon when the sun was scorching hot, and parked my bike opposite the restaurant with no shade. The security guard had a bunch of sunshades to cover the passenger vans, and the guard was busy pushing the passenger vans, so I borrowed one to cover the seat. When I got almost there, the security guard asked me to turn around so he could cover it for me, but I refused to let him cover it myself. I didn't understand why, so I just brought it back to him, and asked him again to cover my bike. In the end, after finishing eating and going out, I saw that the bike had been exposed to the sun all day without any shade, while the other bikes next to it were all covered. The seat was boiling hot, and the helmet was so hot that the foam layer inside was burned black. I don't understand what happened 😕

I'm a vegetarian, so I went there after seeing the reviews on Google. We were the only foreigners, but we spoke English fluently. The place was friendly, clean, and had a great atmosphere. It turned out to be a high-end vegetarian restaurant. There were many cheaper options, but I didn't know about them, so I searched and ended up going because it was close to my accommodation.
I ordered a set meal with hot pot, and it was plenty for three adults. I had a lot of leftovers.
Every dish had a different flavor and was delicious. I was quite full, but since it wasn't meat or fried food, I didn't feel heavy or burdened.

Good food.

Reviewer_name: Quách Minh Tiến (Kiến Trúc Thuận Tự Nhiên)
Review_text: One of the delicious vegetarian restaurants in Da Nang. Frugal food, cool quiet space, reasonable prices.

The food is vegetarian, so there will definitely be likes and dislikes. It is definitely not a healthy taste. It is a vegetarian restaurant that feels like it is just imitating it. Above all, it was very inconvenient that there were no napkins or tissues other than the paid wet wipes while charging a high price. There are many people who don't use wet wipes when they go to restaurants. I ordered two dishes. I ended up taking one to-go. The atmosphere is good, so I recommend visiting with a special guest, but... You should use a separate table. It is very noisy because the conversation echoes in places where there are many tables.

Delicious and quality vegetarian restaurant. The second time the quality was still as good as the first time coming here. Going on the 14th day of the lunar month was not as crowded as the last time we went on the 15th.

I had a great experience at this Chinese restaurant with a real Hong Kong–style vibe. The suckling duck was excellent—the skin was crispy and flavorful, definitely a highlight. The sour and spicy fish soup stood out too, very unique and full of flavor. Portions are generous, and there are plenty of options on the menu at reasonable prices. I also enjoyed the noodles, which were perfectly chewy and well-prepared. Overall, a nice spot to enjoy authentic flavors with good value.

The food is delicious but the service staff's attitude is terrible.

I hope the owner/manager will review and retrain the service staff. The recent times I have been here, I have not received service quality commensurate with the price.

The last time was this afternoon, the female service staff had a very bad attitude, when I entered the restaurant, I saw their frowning faces and the food was not delicious. Always frowning, not welcoming. When they brought the food out, they immediately turned away. It was unpleasant from the moment the customer entered until the customer paid, but it still did not get better.

I do not understand why the service staff have this attitude. The customer spent money and still received the opposite attitude.

I hope the restaurant improves!

09/21/25. Hong Kong 🇭🇰 Duck 🦆 restaurant in Da Nang.

To diversify our meals while in Da Nang, tried out this Cantonese style eatery.

The rich aroma of roasted meats and the eclectic decor amped up the Hong Kong feels. The table topped by mah jong tiles was a memorable touch.

We ate here twice. The first time we enjoyed the Roast duck and Wanton Noodle Soups. The second time was not as enjoyable with stir fry noodles not available as their stove was not working. But the Roast duck and Soya Chicken were consistently very tasty.

Must visit!

Rice with different types of meat is just great if you want a dense and fatty meal. Cool. The salad of smashed cucumbers was perfectly complemented by spices and herbs. I must say the food here is quite good. We ate there before and came back this time. But this time we were not satisfied with the service
My friend and I arrived at the restaurant at 20:35. Because we did not carefully research the restaurant's closing time, we went to eat late. The staff still received customers as usual. While waiting for the food, I saw them cleaning the restaurant. Because I was shy, I asked what time the restaurant closed, and they said 21:00, so I told them that because we did not research the time, we were sorry if we were late. My friend and I tried to eat as quickly as possible so that they had time to clean up and leave early.
While we were eating, at 21:07 the staff turned off the lights and air conditioner, at 21:12 they brought the bill out and left on the table, saying we had to pay right away (a polite way of chasing us away), and it was not very pleasant.
From the beginning, if you have accepted customers, you have accepted that your closing time will be a little later than the time on your contract. If you do not want to accept customers anymore, you should notify us that you are about to close or something so that we can go eat somewhere else comfortably. :(

Plus points: enthusiastic staff.
Food portions are quite large.
Minus points: Not very appetizing.
Normally not good, not bad. I ordered 2 noodle dishes, 1 stir-fried vermicelli with ribs, 1 half roast duck, fried wonton.

A Taste of Hong Kong in Da Nang

Vinh Hanh Cantonese BBQ didn't just meet our expectations-it far exceeded them. From the moment we stepped in, the rich aroma of roasted meats and the lively atmosphere transported us straight to Hong Kong.

They had a hard time during Covid, where the quality fell a little, but now they are back full throttle at the highest level, they can compete with even a traditional BBQ place in Hong Kong.

The Peking Duck was flawless-crispy, golden skin with succulent meat with hoisin sauce. The Roasted Crispy Pork Belly was unbelievable-shattering crackling. melt-in-your-mouth fat, and tender, flavorful meat. Their signature sauces took every bite to another level, each carefully crafted to enhance the meats.

Service was fast, friendly, and passionate about the food. Every dish was prepared with authentic Cantonese precision, making this a must-visit spot for anyone craving real Hong Kong BBQ in Da Nang.

This restaurant was such a pleasant surprise found via a Tik Tok review. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by the hanging crispy, succulent, glistening fresh BBQ duck and pork. You can see more meat roasting in the ovens, and the continuos takeaway orders being prepared.

This restaurant looks like it has only a few tables, but there is a second floor that provides even more dining including a great covered balcony.

We ordered the platter with 2 types of meat, concurring with others that while we found it ample to feed 2 people it seemed smaller than it appears on the menu.

The meats were tender and seasoned perfectly with authentic flavours. Morning glory was fresh with the undeniable sizzling garlic juices, and our fried rice held the authentic flavour, though we did find it odd that it contained zucchini but perhaps this is how it’s made in certain areas of HK but was new to us.

There were a lot of staff in the restaurant, but it seemed like they needed more servers on the ground floor as our waiter was run off his feet and did a great job at providing exceptional service despite the demand.

A warm welcome was the complimentary beverage for International Women’s Day, and the Peach Tea we ordered was super concentrated with actual slices of peach in it.

We look forward to returning to this wonderful restaurant in the city of Da Nang. Parking was easy, with a guard providing assistance out the front. Also great that they accept card payments.

First time eating Chinese food, the food was oily (depending on the dish) and had a bland taste, with a characteristic dry chili scent. I ordered 2 duck rice dishes (no soup) and stir-fried pho, with stir-fried chili oil served with the dish, seasoned to taste, stir-fried pho with strong flavor is to my taste. Snakehead fish soup with sour cabbage was okay, I ordered a small bowl as shown in the picture, the cooking oil was floating. 
Customers came and went regularly, the staff did not pay attention to let customers get their own menus. The menu design was not good, although it was thick, beautiful and clear, but it felt difficult to flip back and forth. 
The kitchen was opposite the customer seating area, there were many staff, the dishes came out quickly. 
The tables sitting next to the door facing the street were slightly blocked by the door because it was higher than the neck when the customers sat, the chairs were low and the tables were high so it was uncomfortable to sit. 
In conclusion: the food was not bad but not to my taste, except for the rice dishes, I can consider coming back.

Extremely bad. Went in at 7pm, went up to the place and ordered Charcoal Duck but the staff said it was out of stock. I changed to another dish and ordered stew soup but it was also out of stock. I asked if there was anything else on the menu that I could order and they said there was only char siu left. My family asked if there was black pepper stewed chicken and the staff said there was. I told them to wait a moment so I could check the dish and order again. About 5 minutes later I called another person to order Black Pepper Stewed Chicken and that person said the restaurant had no more stewed chicken and all the stews were out. I stood up and left. The restaurant had many empty tables on the 2nd floor. I will never come back again.
Red pork is the most delicious. Delicious fried food, full of shrimp, good service staff, ordered to take home, neatly packed, moderate price

I ordered a Yuanyang coffee and within 5 seconds I wanted to change it to Xianning Qi, but they said the order couldn't be changed. They forced me to buy something. The beef tenderizer they used in the dry fried beef noodles was so unpalatable, I won't be back for a second time!!

Loved this restaurant on my trip to Da Nang. Food was really good especially the meat combo which you'd get roasted pork, duck, chicken and char siu pork.  We came here twice because the food was so good. Get their soups, all of them are good. The tofu dish was just okay for me. All the roasted meats were so delicious. The hong Kong style french toast was out of this world and same with their hong Kong milk tea, so good. The wait staff here were so kind and sweet too and yet they had to deal with rude customers when we were there. Not going to name the country these customers were from but this is Vietnam, try to communicate in the local language with a smile.
Even though the waitresses were trying to communicate, yelling at them in your own language wasn't going to get you anything.  They were so rude to the wait staff and I was like what the heck dude, don't travel to other countries if you treat people like that. Then they yelled for the bill in their own language again and then got into their own private luxury van. Clearly money doesn't teach manners.
